Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: Abbieivyshaw
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room for 4 nights on the 9th floor. I agree with other reviews that the rooms are small but it's new York, what do you expect? Also we hardly spent any time in the hotel and the bed was very comfortable. We also had a shared bathroom which worked out fine, we never saw anyone else in there and it was always clean. The staff at the front desk were very helpful with directions, tourist info and booking taxis. It was a nice location away from midtown but it did take about 45 minutes to walk there, although its a nice wall through central park. The subway station is also just outside and only takes 10 minutes to get to midtown. Only downfall is that the elevator broke down for one day but who can help electrics. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: abroch
Reviews.Content: Couldn't ask for a better location for the price. Great neighborhood to explore and the subway is literally right out of the door. Reception was friendly and the room was clean. Honestly for New York, this place is a hidden gem.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Clean Modern Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BostonRico
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Newton is a great No Frills hotel. The rooms are very small but clean, safe, and modern. The hotel is located in the upper West side, but the express subway stop right out front makes the hotel very convenient. Nice neighborhood with Starbucks, CVS, Walgreens, and a variety of restaurants and cafes. Great value for the money !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MDMpr
Reviews.Content: We knew that the deal we got was was good so we were not expecting much. Trip Advisor reviews had said that the rooms were small but clean - that was acceptable and the rooms were small and clean. In fact the rooms had a fridge, a microwave, coffee facilities - but no bathroom. We did expect a bathroom! When we checked, we found that the small print on the booking form said that room type could not be guarenteed, but if a hotel has a 3 star rating, which it did, we presumed that a bathroom would be included in the room price - not so (in this day for goodness sake!). So it was a shared bathroom with who knows who. Then there was the smell. A huge amount of air freshner or something highly scented made it horrible to breath - for someone with asthma a real trigger for an attack. We had to leave the window wide open to deal with the smell (was it covering something up - this was hard to tell). Luckily the weather suited having the window open as it was not too hot or not too cold outside. There was also no air con that we could see, so the heat would be dreadful in the summer. Finally when we did venture into the bathroom to chance a shower there was no hot water. Calls to reception revealed that there would not be any for several hours .......

Reviews.Title: “We would return to this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JimJackman
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews we decided to stay in this hotel.we were not disappointed.Very friendly and helpful at reception, we were also upgraded. Rooms clean and tidy, bed comfortable, carpets could be refurbished, bathroom excellent...good price for manhatten.10 minute ride from Times Square, take the 2 or 3 lines.....Plenty of local restaurants to eat in....also on the uptown greyline.....this is a good hotel and as I said made all the better by reception staff.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Service in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Denarius W
Reviews.Content: Worst Hotel in NYC! The pictures posted do not accurately reflect the living arrangements. Furthermore, I stayed here and dealt with the worst customer service and front desk clerk I have ever seen. Just so you're aware in case you decide to go, he's a middle aged Indian man who works the night shift. I was thrown out of the hotel at 1am on a cold night and was not given an explanation why nor was I given a chance to retrieve my things. When I politely asked him if there was any way we could work things out he screamed in my face "Leave here and do not come back." Upon returning to the hotel several hours later to work things out he threatened me and proceeded to aggressively yell at me as I walked up the stairs to my room. I can not express to you how rude, judgmental, and immature this man was. You would think someone who paid to have a hotel room could at least stay in their hotel room, but nope, not at good ole Hotel Newton! Oh, and by the way there's only one bathroom per floor and if it gets locked with no one in it good luck having any of the quality staff open it for you.

Reviews.Title: “I left my heart iin NYC”
Reviews.Author: happyhearthome
Reviews.Content: Happened upon Hotel Newton on tripadvisor early 2011.. After a long trip from Oz, we were told they had no booking from us, even though I emailed to confirm our booking. They put us up in a room and told us not to worry and that it would be rectified next morning.. We went out the following morning and when we arrived back that evening, our luggage had been sent to our new room. The rest of our stay was fantastic-great help at the desk, the doorman was lovely and our room was cleaned beautifully every day. We chose to stay away from Midtown and loved how this hotel was in walking distance to Central Park, The Met etc. We used the laundry around the block which was an experience(they weigh your clothes for the price) and return it to the hotel. we also tried Artie's up the road and loved the huge pastrami on rye, pickles etc, even though their knish was burnt(better at the cart opposite the Museum of Natural history) Loved it so much we're staying here again in 2012!

Reviews.Title: “City trip”
Reviews.Author: FrankvdP
Reviews.Content: Good location, Underground across the street. Very good breakfast next to Hotel. Rooms are very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Newton Veteran for 10 years”
Reviews.Author: Simple_Country_Boy
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this property for over 10 years, beginning in 2002. The Newton has been thru MANY changes, including RECENTLY. There are limitations with any property and other reviewers have noted several. I choose the Newton for inexpensive, very small [tiny, actually] accomodations for myself. They display a picture of the "single" room on their website - it has a single bed and can't be as much as 200 square feet - including the closet and bathroom. Think economy cruise cabin. In 2010, booked 2 larger rooms for a total of 4 guests and we all survived. As others have noted, noise can be a problem but my recent visits [several times a year] have been mostly quiet. On my last visit - Feb 18-19 2012 - the elevator wasn't working reliably, which was a problem with my "single" room on the 9th floor. The "single" rooms I usually book now contain a microwave & fridge and I'll continue to stay at this convenient location as long as the price stays low.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay at the Hotel Newton”
Reviews.Author: Carol757
Reviews.Content: A year and a half ago, we stumbled upon the Hotel Newton when we needed an affordable placed to stay in New York while in town to see a Yankees game. This year, we decided to return for a winter theater/shopping weekend. We got a rate of just under $500 total for three nights in a queen room with a seating area that included a small sofa and desk/chair, and you really can't beat that rate for New York even in the off season. As I said before, the Hotel Newton does not try to be a luxury destination. It tries to be the best at what it is -- a budget hotel. Our room was small, even with the seating area, but very clean. The bathroom was also small (I had to leave the door open while drying my hair or my elbow would hit the door) but very clean with quality products in terms of the shampoo and soap. We were on the second floor this trip, and the room was definitely darker than when we stayed on the seventh floor, but the lighting has clearly been upgraded to recessed cans that provided more than enough light. We also had a flat-screen TV in our room (I see some people have complained about old-school TVs in other rooms), along with a mini-refrigerator and microwave. During our last trip, the diner next door to the hotel was closed for renovation. It's now the Manhattan Cafe. We only ate breakfast there, but the food was great and the prices reasonable for New York. We also ate at Long Grain, a Thai restaurant on the same block as the hotel, and at Telio, a Greek restaurant a few blocks down Broadway that we loved. That's one of the great things about its location -- lots of great neighborhood restaurants within walking distance. My only complaint this trip, and it's minor, is that the weather was bitter cold and mounting around the window air conditioner in our room was definitely letting cold air leak into the room that diluted the effect of the radiator heat. I had to put an extra blanket on the bed at night. Nonetheless, we will continue to stay at the Hotel Newton on our trips to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed It.”
Reviews.Author: jarasta
Reviews.Content: Relatively quiet, clean with a pleasant and helpful staff. Great location for upper west side and great prices within 48 hours of stay.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: coolio90
Reviews.Content: 2nd time in New York and wanted to stay away from midtown so chose this hotel in west 96th street. On Broadway and one block off Amsterdam avenue there is tons of bars and restaurants and shops nearby. So much that you dont really need to go into midtown if you dont want to for a night out. The hotel is close to Central park and seconds from the subway. The hotel itself is fine. Clean room with decent bathroom, large bed, plenty of wardrobe space, tv, coffee maker. There is even a fridge, microwave and iron and board. The staff were friendly even though i didnt have much to bother them with. The only downside is no hotel bar or cafe but when you have so many surrounding you its not really needed.plus no climate control in room and it did get very warm at about 6 am onwards

Reviews.Title: “HOME FROM HOME”
Reviews.Author: mrs493
Reviews.Content: Only just been able to write this review as we have been so busy since returning home to uk in dec 11. My thoughts instantly returned to our wonderful 6 day break to New York, I would like to say THANKYOU ... Your staff were more like friends, always there to help, I couldnt sleep because of the time difference, they were always there to have a chat, If we were out for the day, they helped us with directions and if required tickets as well and on return always ask with interest how we got on. When we arrived I couldnt get over the lovely smell as we entered the Hotel, it was very clean. The Diner next door was amaizing, we even made a few friends while in there, The people were really friendly, a lovely safe place to go with great food. We took our 18yr old daughter to celebrate her birthday, along with our older daughter, we had plenty of room in our suite. It was hot but better than being cold. We cant wait to go again, and look forward to bringing our other children with us. Once again thankyou all so much, we all get a complete buzz thinking about our wonderful time we had, It wasnt just great to see new york again, it was a great hotel, great staff, great diner, All of these things make a great holiday. See you all again soon hopefully. Mr Mrs Hall

Reviews.Title: “Feel at home in NY”
Reviews.Author: Teresa M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Newton this past weekend and i would return again no questions asked. When we arrived we were immediately greeted by the staff with a smile, very friendly attitude, and helpfulness so much so they went the extra mile to ensure that we enjoyed are stay. Not only will i be returning but I will be recommending it to others who plan on traveling to NY. Subways were accessible and the restaurants in the area that were recommend we're excellent. I look forward to returning in the near future. Please let your staff know from the doorman, front desk, and housekeeping that i sincerely appreciate there willingness to provide us with the best service. Its definetly a feel at home type of place.

Reviews.Title: “Good, reliable hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melloumoh
Reviews.Content: Newton is in a great location, at a nice section of broadway. Lots of restaurants and convenient stores just outside the door. The subway stop about 50m away is an express stop, so you can travel from times square all the way back in two stops. 15min walk to central park and natural history museum. Rooms are decent size and value for money. Not in the heart of downtown but very easy to get to/from.

Reviews.Title: “The next time I stay here . . . .”
Reviews.Author: KansasJudyK
Reviews.Content: I hope I will be just as satisfied as I was this time. It was my first time at the Hotel Newton and I selected the location to be near my granddaughter's school which was just a couple of blocks away. My daughter and granddaughter stayed with me so I was a solo traveler but a hotel guest with a family. The hotel exceeded my expectations in almost every respect. The staff was super professional and attentive. The room was very clean and comfortable, for the most part. My only complaints are 1) the radiator heat can not be controlled by guests and 2) the television had white vertical lines always present. With respect to the room temperature, we were so thankful we could open the window but that, of course, allowed more street noise in. My daughter retrieved a fan from home and we were able to use that for circulation and "white noise" for the rest of our stay (5 nights total) but most people will not have that option. As far as the television goes, it was certainly tolerable and most folks will not be holed up in their room watching it. We were told that all television sets in the hotel had the lines (see photo). Yes, the elevator is slow but I've experienced worse in Europe. Since we were on the second floor we usually took the stairs. We paid $5 a day for internet - - free would have been nice but no big deal. I booked my room through booking.com and missed a great deal offered by the hotel. I probably should have realized that after the holidays something like that might have been available. The neighborhood had everything we needed and I felt totally safe moving around on my own. Unfortunately, my granddaughter became ill while we were there but even that was manageable with an urgent care location a couple of blocks away and a drug store next door. Central Park is located just a few blocks to the east and a major subway station just steps away. I would absolutely stay at the Hotel Newton again.

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, cleanm, convenient with a touch of atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: James K
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Newton for many years now. It is affordable, the staff are helpful, the rooms sizable, clean and comfortable. There was a slight problem with our heating and toilet on our most recent stay, but these were quickly dealt with. I have stayed at more luxurious places in the city, but in many ways this misses the point of NYC - you want to be out there not inside. With its price and nicely designed decor, the Newton is a perfect budget NY hotel - well-placed on the upper west side if you want to go into Manhattan. but there is also a lot to do in the surrounding neighbourhood. We love the City Diner, the various fruit and veg shops. Zabars is a short walk - handy when you buy their lovely cakes. There is also some decent clothes shopping too. Central Park is 5 mins away which is always a pleasure. We had an early flight this year and the staff helped to organise transport to the airport. I recommend whole-heartedly.

Reviews.Title: “Basic but spotlessly clean, friendly & right beside a subway stop”
Reviews.Author: snottycrab
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel if all you want is somewhere to wash yourself, lay your head at night and maybe watch some tv. The rooms are extremely clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, close to the subway station”
Reviews.Author: mazydee
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very large and spacious, also has a microwave and a mini fridge to reheat and to store things in the fridge which was very handy. The location of the hotel was only a few steps from the 96th St metro station which was very handy to get into Midtown and uptown. Only 10 blocks from Tom's Restaurant (Seinfeld fans). The rooms are a little dated and the decor can do with a revamp. the bed covers were very outdated and the room would change in look if these were more modern. The bathroom had been recently renovated which was good, however, we had issues with the hot water, we had to call the maintanence guy as we had the water running for 25 min and didn't have any hot water. when they came up, they said the water was ok and that it was warm enough. this wasn't acceptable and eventually the only way to fix the issue was to turn off the cold water completely from the pipes which meant that the toilet couldn't flush. The hotel doens't have any free wifi and if you wanted to purchase WiFi it was based on a 12 hour basis. the hotel elevator was so small, old and soo slow. we were on the 7th floor and it took forever for the elevator to turn up as each of the housekeepers had to keep using it with their trolleys to get to and from floors as there wasn't any service lift and as the lift was so small, the trolleys took all the room in the lift which took even longer to call the lift. When we checked out, weren't even asked how our stay was. the concierge pressed the button for the lift for us and expected a tip, when they didn't even offer to assist with our bags. the price of the room was excessively high for the room and service.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to relax after a day's sightseeing.”
Reviews.Author: Jim L
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel for our four day break in NYC on the advice of a travel agent. After a seven hour flight and fifty minute taxi ride myself, my wife and adult son were ready for a rest. On arrival we were immediately offered apologies as the hotel had overbooked and the room we asked for (Queen Room) was not available till the following day. The hotel did however provide us with a double and single room for the one night and both rooms were more than adequate. Afeter a long walk around Central Park we ate out as the hotel did not provide meals (We knew that before we booked) then returned to the hotel and had a perfect nights sleep. The next day after a very hectic day of sightseeing in a very crowded NYC, we were relieved to get off the subway at the station almost opposite the hotel into the peace and tranquility of upper broadway. The Queen Suite was ready for us and we were very very pleased with the layout, the fridge, the coffee maker and the microwave. The rest of our stay was much like the first day, clean, comfortable and very relaxing. The staff were very polite and very helpful. The day before departure, the receptionist on being asked to arrange a cab to the airport, advised us to book a ferry cab which would have eight people on the same journey so the cost would be much less. When we agreed, she told us she would do it for us. Such service. We would recommend this small hotel to those who are there for a short break and want to get away from the hustle and bustle in the evenings and at night. For food a a drink close to the hotel we would recomment The Dive. Great service, cold beer and good wholesome food. To find it, exit the hotel, turn right then first right, then first right again and it is on the right.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Nics-171
Reviews.Content: The room was bigger than expected but the bathroom was tiny, all was clean and working the heater worked well but releases air sometimes and the noise is annoying. Was very pleased with service and staff all were great. There was a good sized fridge and microwave which was great and next door there is a 24 hour pharmacy/deli and a dinner. Only bad point is elevator is old and slow and small. Otherwise great stay with tube nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Vawgin S
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Newton is in an old "knickerbocker-like" building. This should automatically imply that it's old fashioned and smaller. My boyfriend and I went to NYC for 3 days for a show and I picked this place based on past reviews and location. Right outside the door is the subway station. The Hotel has very friendly staff that are very accomodating. Small lobby, with 2 internet stations, a TV, seating, and of course a Christmas Tree. The rooms are accessible by card. I chose a room that had a private bath, as many places in NYC have shared bathrooms, for an extra fee. We had a queen sized bed with clean linens, plenty of towels/washcloths. Our room (315) was a bit small, but we weren't in NYC to hang out in the room so it didn't matter. The room had a big flat screen TV, a fridge and microwave, desk with chair, & nightstands. The room was chilly at first, but I just had to open the radiator valve and in the fridge, turn the thermostat up so that our drinks were cold. They were just conserving energy! AC units stay in the window all winter long, but there wasn't a draft/breeze. View from our window was undesirable, but unimportant to us. Check in is at 3 and check out is at noon. They will hold your bags if desired for a $5 fee. Bottom line: A great place to stay for under $200/night in Manhattan. It was quiet, clean, safe, and affordable. Perfect for our trip! I would stay there again for sure. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “There are better hotels...”
Reviews.Author: abaisden12
Reviews.Content: ...but for a quick getaway like ours, it was near perfect. From the moment we checked in, the staff was very cordial and willing to help out a young couple touring the city (thanks, Mari). Our room was clean and spacious, and had a great view of upper Broadway. The bathroom was newly remodeled and tiled, and even on the 9th floor, had hot water and great pressure. Our only issues with the room: the radiator heat was a little hard to regulate on a chilly night, and the beds were QUITE firm. Yes, the building is older, but quaint... so don't expect a lot of amenities, like breakfast-- but, there are several great delis and restaurants right outside the front door (check out the Europan Deli and the Longgrain Thai restaurant for good inexpensive meals-- for the traditionalist, there is a Starbucks and a McDonald's on the block, too). There is a metro station 20 steps from the hotel's front door (for the 1, 2, & 3 lines) and two convenient garages right around the corner for those driving in. All said, it was a great stay-- friendly staff, great location, and decent price...we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, clean hotel at a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Kate C
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my stay at this hotel. My room was very quiet and clean, and my bed was very soft and comfortable. The mini fridge and microwave were nice as well, especially for storing food/drinks. It seemed to be reasonably priced for NYC, especially given the location, which was right at the metro station on Broadway and 96th (which was a quick ride down to Times Square and several other locations). As people have mentioned, the rooms are small, but are equal in size in comparison to what you would get in similar big cities (especially Europe - London, Paris, Rome all have equally sized rooms), and honestly people, if you are in NYC you shouldn't be using your room for more than sleeping and showering. I got a room with an attached bathroom, which is a must, and it was very clean and spacious. The staff were great and helpful. I loved the hotel, and would definately stay there again at my next NYC visit!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lower than average and pretty expensive.”
Reviews.Author: Daniel025
Reviews.Content: Newton Hotel is conveniently located in a not-so-fancy section of Upper West Side, less than half a block from 96th Street metro station. From there you can get to midtown in less than 15 minutes, which is more than OK. The property is a little bit outdated. The elevator iwas kind of old and somewhat slow. Our room was quite big for NYC standards, but the furniture, curtains and carpet would surely benefit from some update. Bathroom was clean and spacious, but it looked like taken out of a tacky 70s movie. Front desk staff was helpful, and we could get to our room at 12 pm., what was quite nice of them. However, the night shift guy was not as friendly, and when I asked for a razor blade he instructed me to go to next-door convenience store. It was a rather minor issue, but as we had a pretty expensive rate (290 USD for a double room for a night), that comment added insult to injury. I know that NYC hotel prices have gone crazy, but we left there feeling that we paid much more than what the room was worth. Sure, we had a good night’s sleep, but the rate should have been less than a third of what we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Airport shuttle and staff information-beware”
Reviews.Author: BettieBlu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in NY for a combo business and pleasure trip in October. I researched the hotels and booked early. The Newton lived up to our expectations and the reviews on Trip Advisor: it was clean, the staff including Emilio were very helpful, the location was perfect. Yes, the room was small, the ac sounded like a B52 and it wasn't exactly cheerful, but it was more than adequate and certainly worth what we were charged. We would have stayed here again. My following comments are made with hopes that the hotel might better train their staff and that perhaps I can keep the next traveler from making a costly error. We needed to arrange to get to the airport for our flight home. Our previous experience with shuttles has been adequate if not wonderful, and we prefer a cab. Our discussion with the staff at the desk of the Hotel Newton led us to believe that a cab would overcharge, and as the weather for our flight day was going to be rainy, it would be difficult to hail a cab. (Forget that they have a door man and that is part of his job!) The staff recommended the shuttle service they advertise on their desk, Airlink. We requested the hotel desk staff check our department time which they did, and they booked our shuttle for the next day. They didn't give us choices of pick up time nor did they apparently realize the airlines suggest that you get to the airport two hours prior to departure. The desk staff told us our pick up time and that they needed $5 per person cash to hold the reservations (the rest was to be paid in cash to the driver when we were picked up.) Once again, we asked if the pick up time was going to give us enough time to make our flight. They assured us it would. Due to the staff's lack of information or willingness to share, we missed our flight and consequently missed our connecting flight home and had to spend the night in Atlanta at our expense because of the mishandled shuttle reservations. (There was an earlier shuttle pick up at the Hotel Newton and if we had been given that information that would have solved everything.) Here are my suggestions. If you are going to use a shuttle, book it online and use a credit card. Check the reviews of the shuttle company. Make sure it will get you to the airport with plenty of time to spare. Leave yourself at least an hour in the shuttle just for pick ups, plus travel to the airport (JFK being one hour from Manhattan). We were lucky that the airline was able to get us on a later flight and book us on a morning flight the next day without charging us for a new ticket (at a cost of over $400!). Emilio was also kind enough to get us a refund for the Airlink shuttle service. A word to the wise...

Reviews.Title: “A good affordable choice for Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: This part of Manhattan is a desert for decent affordable hotels, with most found in Lower Manhattan or Midtown. Our recent trip plans, though, focused on museums, friends, and meetings on both sides of Central Park. This hotel worked perfectly. Close to 96th street subway stops and buses to Upper East Side museums. This area is more locals than tourists and you're a short walk to Columbia U. I agree with other reviewers that it's hardly fancy, but it is kept clean and front desk is helpful. Don't pay full price, but wait for a deal on one of the various web search sites.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in summary”
Reviews.Author: arnogrand
Reviews.Content: This is a very good hotel. It's kept very cleaned. At least twice a day. The service is good and people are helpful. The staff proved to be flexible regarding wi-fi too. We had a tv down time too which is a shame but I don't think it affected our overall vision of this hotel. The location is perfect next to the subway !

Reviews.Title: “Just Adequate”
Reviews.Author: rojersey
Reviews.Content: Floral bedspreads, spongy pillows and cheap polyester linens place this Upper West Side hotel in the mediocre but tolerable category. Amenities were spare, towels not plush and most Irritating, a fee to store luggage for a few hours. Mattresses were low quality and comfort and the $300 per night charge was really exorbitant. BUT the property is clean and located a few seconds from the Subway making all of NYC easily accessible. Try an opaque site and I'll bet you can do better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great locacation!”
Reviews.Author: Jasper F
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Hotel Newton last spring with my best friend. We were celebrating my 50th in NYC. The hotel was convenient, clean, comfortable and literally a few steps from the subway. I highly recommend The Hotel Newton. Its location is excellent, its price was reasonable and the staff was friendly and helpful. I would most definitely return to this hotel the next time I'm in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Amazing Value for money in NYC”
Reviews.Author: fpusacampbell
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel for 2 nights at the end of Aug. We took the option of a double room with shared bathroom as we wernt going to be in the room all the time and just needed the bathroom for showering, so suited us. The room we had on the 3rd floor was very small, but that was what I expected for New York. The room was very clean and so was the shared bathroom which is one thing I was worried about, but it wasn't a problem at all. So if you are thinking about booking one of the rooms with a shared bathroom....really, dont worry about it. It's shared between 2-3 rooms, so its nothing to worry about. The location itself is a bit out the way, but there is a metro right outside the hotel. Line 1,2,and 3 take you to Midtown in a couple of minutes, so getting about is easy. This hotel is VERY well priced and well worth the money. Its really ticks all the boxes and if your on a hotel budge and want to spend more money on shopping/sightseeing and want to avoid the high price of Midtown...then I could urge you to consider this fantastic GEM in Uptown NYC

Reviews.Title: “Great loaction. Tiny rooms.”
Reviews.Author: runrhi
Reviews.Content: 1. Clean room - nice bathroom 2. Helpful and nice staff - gave me a room when I arrived at 8 am 3. Housekeepers clean room really fast and early 4. Twin room is small as a postage stamp. About 18 inches of carpet around the bed. 5. Wifi $4.50 for 24 hours 6. Great location - subway across the street; diner next door etc

Reviews.Title: “This is Where I Stay in NYC”
Reviews.Author: djphotos
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel for quite a few years because it is so convenient. A new subway station is just at the corner in the middle of the street and it takes just a few minutes to get to Times Sq. on the express train. There are restaurants next door and nearby and Central Park is just a couple blocks away. The rooms and bathrooms are always neat and clean. The elevators are sometimes very slow so I request a room on one of the lower floors so I don't have to climb so many stairs. WiFi is not free, but there are two computers in the lobby for guest use. I used my credit card, costing me $3.00, to use a computer to check in for my flight and print my boarding pass. The computer became non responsive and my boarding pass did not print. When I complained to management, it was suggested that I try the other computer, again spending another $3.00. You can also feed $1.00 bills into the machines. I had to get my boarding pass at the airport. This is my only complaint about the Newton Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Small - But this is New York”
Reviews.Author: Coyote88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights in the Hotel Newton at the end of US trip. The good points - a) Very close to the subway b) The Manhattan diner next door, but one, was excellent for breakfast and dinner. c) The staff were helpful and friendly d) The cost for New York was bearable d) The room was clean. The less good points a) The room was very small (but for the price ......) Our room, which was ensuite, had a full size, under worktop, fridge and a microwave. These took up valuable room. b) The Wi-fi was not free and the reception in our room so poor that we had to connect in the lobby. c) There is only one slow lift and we were on the eighth floor. All in all OK for what we wanted but next time we'll stay out in New Jersey and bus or train back and forth each day.

Reviews.Title: “Very good deal”
Reviews.Author: malatestiano
Reviews.Content: Super convenient location, away from the noise of downtown but very close to W 96th st subway station. As stated by other reviewers the rooms are small, but clean and quiet. The rates for the quality and for NYC are very competitive. Check in and Check out were very fast and hassle free.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: HGR12
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 days here and found it a great starting point for exploring NY. The elevator wasn't working one of the days, but otherwise a hassle free experience. Room was on the small side but cleaning was great. Only thing I really missed was free wi-fi, which meant quite a few visits to Starbucks. :-) Location is perfect with Central park close by and subway station just a few metres away. Next door diner was good for breakfast and there are many nice restaurants on nearby Amsterdam ave. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “better than it looks”
Reviews.Author: lawyerx2
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was great - I left a valuable set of notes, they found them, and scanned those pages I needed urgently and sent the rest by FED EX. While the rooms are a little warn, the hotel was very clean, the location near the subway was great, the rooms were quiet, the microwave and fridge were convenient, and it was close enough to riverside park and central park for jogging. If they upgraded the furniture and decor this would go from a really good to a really great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Hotel Newton! Comfy, quick stay”
Reviews.Author: wandersmuch
Reviews.Content: What a neat little place-- on Labor Day weekend, a single room happened to pop open and I snagged it, and wasn't let down. The room was pretty spacious with a desk and the remodeling was really nice, although I am not a fan of hideous bedspreads, but the bathroom is indeed gorgeous. Nice front desk service, but paid wifi was a bummer (albeit cheap). Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “you can see the metro station from the front door”
Reviews.Author: DrMiriam
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last month with my teenaged son. It was an excellent, quiet retreat where we could rest up between bouts of experiencing this wonderful, overwhelming city. We went everywhere on the subway, and it was a huge plus to have it deliver us virtually to our front door. The rooms are not fancy but the beds were very comfortable, it was very clean, and it was quiet. What more do you really need? Front desk staff were polite but not exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in upper west side”
Reviews.Author: willtravel2001
Reviews.Content: Very nice for 4 ladies traveling to the US Open tennis tournament. We had a deluxe junior suite and enjoyed having the 2nd sink in the kitchenette area. Very safe and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Shawn M
Reviews.Content: This may have been the smallest hotel room I've ever stayed in, but it was as expected for a building of this vintage. The bathroom was nicely and recently renovated. The location was great for my purposes, (near Columbia University) with the subway station right outside the door. There are good restaurants nearby (the Manhattan Diner was great!) I would stay here again, and would recommend it to friends who are looking for a less expensive alternative to hotels further downtown.

Reviews.Title: “For runners but not only”
Reviews.Author: PaoloP66
Reviews.Content: Hotel Newton was chosen by me because of: 1. Position, close to Central Park, the temple of runners 2. Price/quality ratio according to Tripadvisor I have to say that both points were correct. For runners, the hotel is just 600 m from Central Park, and it's mitical Reservoir. For everybody, metro station is literally 50 m from the Hotel, and in just 10 min you can be in Times Square without changing train. Wifi is available at just 5$/day(even if I believe it should be free). The only con is that breakfast is NOT INCLUDED.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: StefanLsweden
Reviews.Content: The location is great (right next to 96th street subway where 1,2 and 3 trains always stop). The rooms are nice but the bed has a plasticlike layer. Not very nice, specially not if it is hot since it easily gets wet and sticky. The elevator is also slow and not very nice. Other than that everything is good apart from the fact that they charge you for WiFi, Great value for New York all in all. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Linshears
Reviews.Content: Hotel Newton is located in the Upper West Side, within a few yards of West 96th Subway station. The area is great, with many small independent food shops to purchase snacks, and two doors away from the Manhattan Diner where I had breakfast every morning. I thought that the hotel was excellent value. The room was a good size, the bed was comfortable and it was very quiet. Each room is equipped with an iron and ironing board, hairdryer, fridge and microwave, even the small single room that I was staying in. It was spotlessly clean with no sign of the bed bugs that plague some other hotels. The staff were generally helpful. The daytime Reception staff were good but the evening staff were not so knowledgeable or helpful and, in fact, completely misdirected me on one occasion. However the housekeeping staff were excellent, particularly on my first day when I had a problem with the hairdryer and it was sorted out immediately. I was a lone female traveller and felt completely safe in the area. On one occasion I travelled home on the subway after midnight and didn't feel uneasy at all. I would highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but staff rude.”
Reviews.Author: Carlos S
Reviews.Content: I was there for four days in late July 2011 and think it would be nice to keep the hotel guests' luggage for a short period. On the contrary, had to use a fee based system to keep it for two hours, while having lunch in the vicinity, after check-out. Another negative aspect was the refusal of a maid to help my wife to open the door of a toilet for public use at the hotel. Carlos - Brazil

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff at the front desk - location okay”
Reviews.Author: Frunky
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerk did very little to make my stay enjoyable. No smile, no 'Hello!', no 'How are you?', just a straight 'Yes?' sounding like 'What do you want?'. His attitude was a good sign of my overall experience in that hotel. I had booked a room with two twin beds. The front desk staff charged me for both nights upon arrival. I came a little early and the room was not ready. When I asked to confirm that the room had two beds, I was told it had a queen size bed instead. I insisted on getting the room type I had on my confirmation. The front desk clerk offered to add a roll-away bed instead! When I said 'I would want the room I had reserved', he reluctantly moved me to the appropriate room type. The cleaning staff was noisy and had corridor conversations as early as 7 AM in the morning. At check out, I had the same front desk staff and the same attitude. Again, no greetings. I had to ask for a detailed receipt, apparently a stretch from the usual service. I am a reasonably accommodating customer. It takes me a lot to express dissatisfaction. In that case, I found the service level below average - at least below what I typically experience in three stars hotels. Fortunately, a getaway in New York city is not made to spend too much time in the hotel. I found the location was good as it was right by the subway line that stops at Penn Station. The rate was decent at $ 150 per night. If service is not among your top criteria, this is a satisfactory choice.

Reviews.Title: “Room was misrepresented.”
Reviews.Author: bandywine
Reviews.Content: I checked what was available and it said it was a double bed. I checked it out on the hotel web site. The web site said amenities included a refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. When I got to the hotel with my print out that said a double bed and went to the room, it was the size of a closet with a single bed, bed side table and a tv on the wall. It was 11 feet wide with no refrigerator ,etc. The bed was situated with my head 4 feet from the air conditioner. I got 4 hours sleep because it was so noisy and the air was blowing only head. It was clean and I did feel safe for a positive comment. I would not have stayed there if the available room had been accurately represented.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice area!!”
Reviews.Author: bjrWisconsin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Newton for 5 days in April 2011. I read reviews on trip advisor (the only one I use) and it fit my needs. It is on the upper east side and the subway was out the front door and not even a half a block away. Very nice subway station and it took me everywhere I needed to go. No restaurant in hotel but plenty close by; McDonalds, Starbucks and a few deli's. The lobby was spacious and had two computer stations (pay as you surf) and a fast elevator. The room was clean, especially nice bathroom and very comfortable for one person. The hotel staff were somewhat arrogant and standoff-ish, but efficient. The doorman was the nicest person on staff. So willing to help. Needed to walk up steps to get into the main lobby and he was always at the ready. Area was safe to walk about in the evening. They did not have an airport service to offer, but I usually book the hotel shuttle round trip and no problems there. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!! Glad we finally stayed here!”
Reviews.Author: keharty
Reviews.Content: We currently live in California but my husband is a native New Yorker. We usually take a trip to NYC about once a year and have stayed in different hotels everytime. I had heard about the Hotel Newton a few years ago but never ended staying there. This trip we were taking some especially budget-minded family members for a little reunion of sorts. I remembered the Hotel Newton, checked it out some more, and decided this sounded like a good location and a good deal as well. My husband and I reserved a Superior Queen as did his older sister and her partner. The younger sister and her husband and two teenaged daughters went with the Deluxe Double. When we arrived those of us who had reserved the Superior Queen rooms were upgraded (at no extra cost) to Deluxe Queen rooms. We were on the 8th floor but I can't remember the room number. The Deluxe Queen rooms were very roomy by NYC standard with plenty of room. We had a nice flat screen television and a good sized closet. Rooms were very clean. The bathroom was a bit small and the only thing I found weird is that there was a window in the shower itself that wasn't privacy glass. As our room faced the street with other buildings across the street I felt a little uncomfortable as the window would show everything from about the waist up. Maybe it was one way glass? Our family members traveling with teenagers ended up on another floor and their room was considerable smaller than ours, especially with two teenaged girls and all their stuff. They had a problem with their air conditioner not working but when they complained it was promptly replaced with a brand new one. Yes, the elevator is slow and there is only one but as we were never in a hurry that wasn't a big deal. Front desk staff was great! Location is good in a nice family neighborhood. When walking on a back residential street we even came upon a little girl and her dad with a lemonade stand. We also spotted actor Matt Dillon one night! Depending on which subway lines you are taking the station is either very close or a bit of a walk. There was a deli (can't remember the name) a couple of doors south of the hotel that served great breakfast items at really good prices. We got our breakfast there everyday. I would highly recommend the Hotel Newton to anyone looking to stay at a comfortable, clean, reasonably priced hotel in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: cheekymole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights. Superb location for hopping on the subway, spotless rooms, friendly and helpful staff. Thank you all for making our stay in New York so pleasant - will definitely recommend and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Riley327
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Room 912 which was exceptionally comfortable and clean. I had a nice shared bathroom, not a dust to be seen, just spotless. There was some noise outside the hotel which could be heard in the room but overall the noise was minimal. A very great location in the Upper West Side, few blocks to Central Park, Starbucks, Bank of America ATM, Gourmet Café, charming boutique, nail spa and Subway access - it has it all. Thank you to Jan, Eduardo, Andrew, Charles and to all the staff for the best stay I have ever had away from home. Their dedication is second to none and they exceeded my expectations. I look forward to my next NY holiday and I'll definitely stay at Hotel Newton. xx

Reviews.Title: “Rudest front desk staff ever!”
Reviews.Author: janecmelbourne
Reviews.Content: Was incredibly disappointed with the room and service at this hotel. The hotel itself is badly in need of refurbishment and the rooms could use some more regular upkeep. Our heater was leaking and the toilet blocked several times. However, it was the rude employees at the front desk who really spoilt our stay. Completely hopeless and just plain rude. Try to charge us twice (we had already paid and booked on Expedia). They were also hopeless with their wireless interest, which, despite being expensive, kept playing up.

Reviews.Title: “You Get What You Pay For. But That's OK.”
Reviews.Author: TommyBoy94
Reviews.Content: If you keep thinking "value" during your stay at this hotel near 96th and Broadway, you will be fine. Otherwise, you may be disappointed. There Newton is clean, well tended, safe, bed-bug free (According to the "Bedbug Registry.Com), cordial and well-staffed by helpful and knowledgable personnel. How many hotels in any part of Manhattan can make those claims at $139 per night! (Plus taxes, of course). In fact, there are few other hotels in the city of any description where you can get that price. At that rate, you do have to share a bathroom down the hall with a few other guests, though for a little more you can get a room with your own toliet facilities. The shared bathrooms are meticulously maintained and, to be honest, I only saw one other guest who used the bathroom ever so breifly in 2 nights at the hotel. Besides, there are 8 floors, each seemingly with one shared bathroom per suite of rooms. So, if your floor is in use, you have 7 more to try. The clientele is a largely European crowd attracted by the bargain prices. Obviously this place is touted in European guidebooks of America. The clientele is quite varied in age, but mostly quiet, patient and travel-savvy. And best of all, you are in New York City, a walk away from some attractions and a brief subway trip away from almost all the major places. The Newton is just across the street from the IRT line 96th Street stop. OK...so what do I mean when I say you get what you pay for. Well the rooms are very small...probably equivalent to a 2 star hotel in Paris. In our room, the closet was not too ingeniously placed right next to the front door, so you couldn't open your closet and the front door at the same time. Plus, the closet was placed where the bathroom would have been...only big a problem for very drunk guests in the middle of the night who forget there is no bathroom. Let's see...one morning at checkout time the only elevator broke down. This was no problem for us at a lower floor, but I feel sorry for guests who had to lug their belongings down in the extreme heat from the upper floors. To be fair, the Hotel staff was quite willing and able in assisting guests with that task. There are two computers for guest use in the lobby (For a price...20c per 15 minutes...not bad). Naturally one of those computers was out of order. And the worst part...while rooms are non-smoking...the previous occupants of our room had ignored this rule. Cigarette smoke clung to everything in the small room. Despite the fact that we kept the very efficient air conditioning blasting for our 2 day stay, the stale cigarette odor never completely washed away. The Upper West Side neighborhood near the Newton is largely residential with the usual array of shops and services that grace a good residential scene. There has been a moderate uptick in panhandling over the past couple of years, but the neighborhood is well policed and largely hassle-free. There is the problem of finding a good comfortable neighborhood bar/restaurant in this area. "The Regional" with decent, sturdy Italian cooking and a really fine bartender comes closest to meeting this need. Otherwise, there are 2 taverns in the area which literally names themselves "dive bars"...which,unfortunately, in my opinion...is an all too apt description of those 2 establishments. You need to walk about 10 blocks up into the Columbia University neighborhood to find the right kinds of pubs. Again, since this is New York, I don't have to advise you on where to go to find anything and everything you want. But in this particular neighborhood, that walk to Columbia is worth it. The campus architecture and the whole atmosphere of the place is quietly outstanding. It is also cool to walk through Riverside Park at 95th Street and make your way to "Hudson Beach" a sprawling outdoor cafe of random tables overlooking the river. Sunset there is especially eye-popping. Children and dogs and all kinds of recreational venues add to the festival atmosphere. The service is slow, so avoid the Cheeseburger unless you enjoy stiff and lifeless cheeseburgers that failed to make their way from grill to your table in anything approaching a normal time.

Reviews.Title: “Good ... with some surprises!”
Reviews.Author: SaminBayat
Reviews.Content: +++ Positive: 1)The hotel is in a good location and it is a two minute walk away from subway station that gives access to subway lines 1, 2 and 3 which can directly take you to Times Square. 2)The hotel and its room are clean and relative to the price you can get good service. 3)The staff were polite and kindly offered to keep our suitcases for free (you have to pay for lockers) on the last day of our stay, before we go to the airport. - - - Negative: 1)The first surprise we had was the size of our room. We booked a Superior Double through priceline, and the pictures of those rooms on Hotel's website looked great. But the room we got was very small, we couldn't even put our two suitcases easily in the room. The help desk did not bother to explain what the problem was, they just promised to do what they could to change our room and they didn't do anything. (and honestly, we didnt ask anymore since we were too busy enjoying New York). Still, we were happy to at least have our own bathroom!! 2)The room was very cold and after two times calling the reception and making them believe there was something wrong, they finally sent a maintenance guy to fix our heater. The guy fixed the problem but left a leaky heater and a lot of water on the floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good value hotel on the west side”
Reviews.Author: sirt0m
Reviews.Content: We spent 9 days at Hotel Newton and we are absolutely satisfied with our stay. We had the Junior Deluxe Suite and it was large enough for two adults and a baby (with big stroller and his own babycrib). We had two large beds, a small kitchen bench with microwave and refrigerator, a decent sized bathroom aswell as a little separate storage room. The cleanliness of the room was spotless, even tough they forgot to add more toilet paper a couple of days (we had spare in our luggage so it was not mentioned). There was a heatwave when we visited NYC so we used the A/C a lot. Unfortunately the A/C was noisy so it couldn't be used during the night. Had to turn it on for some minutes during the night to cool the room down occasionally. As for the neighbourhood, we got everything we wanted just minutes away. There are plenty of restaurants in the area, and if you are into pizza, Pizza Famiglia on 96th & Amsterdam is the place to go. Best pizza I've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “I recommended this to all my friends”
Reviews.Author: ChrisMaes
Reviews.Content: The only negative things I could come up with is that the elevator is indeed really slow and you have to pay extra for the internet connection. Other than that, this hotel is really bang for the bucks. Friendly staff, large clean rooms with microwave and refrigerators, clean bathrooms, close to subway,... I recommend this hotel to all my friends

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Darn Good NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: chet_Maryland
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 teens) stayed here in June for a family wedding. We stayed in a sJr Suite with 2 queen beds and although the accommodations were a little tight, the sitting room provided enough breathing space for us to have a very pleasant trip. The hotel is immaculate, wood is polished, corners are clean, just a really nice place. The price is tolerable and actually very good for new york. Although it is upper west side, the subway is right across the street which makes navigating really easy. There are several excellent restaurants close by. By far the best NY hotel I have found to stay at for a weekend trip. Parking isn't too outrageous for new york. We'll be back

Reviews.Title: “So You Think You Can't Afford New York”
Reviews.Author: DavidAWooo
Reviews.Content: Well the Hotel Newton makes it affordable... I was advised by many to pay more and stay Downtown. I ignored the advice and saved $800 by doing so. I paid a mere $27 for a week Subway Pass and easily cruised the city every day and night - unbeatable value - London Transport take note... The hotel itself was welcoming and friendly, accomodating and pleasant. Rooms were spotless clean every day, quiet and relaxing with no traffic or external noise. It becomes an Oasis after a hards days tourism... Every possible need is on the doorstep - 96st Station has train stops for both local and express, shops, restaurants, bars and Central Park are all in easy walking distance. There is a Hertz car rental right on the next street so if you are having a twin city holiday - its so easy its not true! The only minor complaint was the carpets had a doggy smell, but on day two they replaced them and the doggy smell went away! Hence I give this hotel a 5 - Excellent. Without reservation - book this hotel, visit NYC - and don't fall for the high price stuff in Downtown..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location, great people”
Reviews.Author: luka07044
Reviews.Content: Since I had actually finished my degree in late 2010 and could march in 2011, I stayed here for my Columbia University graduation with my husband and family in May. The hotel is situated in an absolutely great location---near the university, a few blocks to Central Park, the subway, great restaurants like Gennaro, Pio Pio, Acqua, and Carmine's---there's even 2 Starbucks located within a block, Duane Reade, and a diner right downstairs that was excellent. Don't worry if you forget anything on your trip, because everything is at your fingertips. The staff at the hotel was very accomodating. When we checked in, they gave us an upgrade, which I didn't realize at first, but was absolutely grateful that my 80 year old father had a very spacious room! Everything was clean and the rooms that my family and I stayed in had large refrigerators to store drinks and food that we bought. The hotel has tremendous character. You can take the stairs (there are two stairwells) or you can take the elevator. Since this is an older building, the elevator is small and runs at its own pace, but we found the stairs just fine. The bathrooms seemed to have been redone recently and were very nice. We checked all of the beds and linens upon arrival and all were very clean. In the hallways, there was a smell of smoke by only one of our rooms, but we weren't bothered at all as we travel often and there were many people from around the globe. There was a Hertz parking garage around the corner which offered a hotel rate at $27 a night. Given the fact that we have parked often in NYC, this was a bargain rate. Overall, I would recommend the Hotel Newton. The staff was attentive and the place is an absolute charm! Bypass any of the chain hotels any day and stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for us!”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel3737
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed with extended family for our daughter's med school graduation from Columbia. This location worked out great. The best part about the hotel was the staff. They worked very hard to make sure that we had everything we needed. We stayed in two deluxe junior suites which had a small separate area with a kitchen area and table and chairs. The rooms were fine for us. This is an older hotel, but our rooms were clean. The bed was very firm, but comfortable, with plenty of pillows and extra blankets provided. The air conditioner worked well, but was noisy. There is only one small elevator, which was a bit rickety. We occasionally had to wait a bit, especially in the morning. There were many restaurants within a few blocks. It was a short taxi ride up to the medical school which was perfect. There was also a subway stop right outside the hotel which made it easy for my daughter to get to us. There was parking nearby for $25/day. They had an internet charge or $5 a day which ran from noon to noon. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting their children at Columbia or any of the other nearby universities. It was a good central location! I only wish we had found it sooner! Compared to some of the other hotels we've stayed in in New York, I felt like we got good value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably Priced, clean, close to station what more can you ask for”
Reviews.Author: Schumi5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in November 2010, was a great stay. although the rooms were not the biggest we've seen for the price we paid we didn't expect anymore. Reception staff very kind, no hassles the whole stay. Great location a door step away from train station which was only a 5 min ride down to times square. would defenatley stay here again. Great restaurants also very close by

Reviews.Title: “Make Sure You Get What You Asked For”
Reviews.Author: CarmenSanDiego
Reviews.Content: Be aware that a "Standard Room" is a tiny room with a full size bed. I booked a room FOR TWO six weeks in advance from a major hotel booking website. On my arrival in NYC, I was issued a cubicle with a full sized (double) bed. When I asked if I could upgrade, I was informed that the hotel was completely booked. My son had to stay with a friend in Brooklyn as there was no way we could both sleep comfortably there. I contacted the manager on my return and was informed that I was given the correct room and was told to contact Hotels.com so they can "explain the situation from their operation side."(?) I was told I should have upgraded to a Deluxe room or contact the hotel directly beforehand to ensure I got what I wanted. From the responses here, I suspect I will get another defensive response. May I suggest to the manager that HE contact the major booking website I used so that they can clarify this issue for future customers. To be fair, the front desk staff was friendly and courteous and the hotel was very clean. You have top pay $1 for every five minutes of internet use. The hotel does not have a restaurant and there is no breakfast offered. I would not pay this kind of money for this type of accomodation or service again. I have stayed in many other hotels in NYC that offer more for less. Look around or ask questions before booking with this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Razvan007
Reviews.Content: My expectations are not high when staying in New York City. All hotels are expensive and they are all poor compared to similar level hotels anywhere else in the world. With this in mind, Hotel Newton is a decent hotel located in the upper west side, where I needed to be. Compared to other hotels in the area i think this one was a good choice. The street noise was lower than others, the room was clean and the service was good. I was on a business trip and the only thing i needed from the hotel was a place to sleep. Would I recommend this hotel? If you want to stay in this specific area of New York, then yes.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and convenient”
Reviews.Author: rivermedway
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a group of about 20 people on a sight-seeing holiday. The best thing about the hotel is that it seemed bed-bug free. I couldn't see any sign of them and nor did anybody else in the group as far as I know. The room was also very clean and tidied very well each day. It's in a fantastic location, a couple of minutes' walk away from the Metro station, so you could be in Times Square in ten minutes. The location also felt safe. the staff were generally helpful, especially when I needed help with the code for dialling home. My room also had a fridge and microwave. I would be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “FRIENDS NOT STAFF”
Reviews.Author: BETTYMATT
Reviews.Content: Well, What does one want from a hotel in a Big City? Answer, everything that The Newton has to offer. Our second stay at this hotel and, YES, I can give a list of minor irritations (not bed bugs by the way) that on the surface are being remedied as I type. The décor and flooring are a little tired, but as we left the paint brushes were out. The room isn’t enormous, but we don’t wish to stay in it all day, ‘cos my wife needs to be in MACY’S/J C PENNY’S or sight seeing the Big Apple. The facilities, fridge, microwave, coffee maker and TV allow you to have breakfast in the room, provide your own ingredients, save money and get out on the road quicker. (Previously mentioned by another contributor has already mentioned.) Bed was more than comfortable, shower room O.K. and cleaner did 100% job every morning. Internet access in foyer was adequate. The DINER adjacent is fine, we found the CITY DINER about 5/6 blocks down Broadway superb and yes; be very wary tax and service adds almost 25% to your restaurant tab. There is a FAMIGLIA PIZZA House on 96th right out of the hotel, 2nd right and then it’s on the corner of AMSTERDAM, brilliant PIZZAS. The METRO is 1 minute away, and this particular station is ion the 2 & 3 express line, 4 minutes to TIME SQUARE, additionally; if you’re there for a week the weekly Metro Pass is only £27$, fantastic value. We love the Hotel and the City, sadly airfares seem to be getting ridiculous, so; I hope it doesn’t stop us returning. Finally, and most importantly, the staff. NO they’re not staff; they’re true professionals and go the extra yard every time. I was taken aback that they remembered us, (can’t for the life of me think why) EDUARDO, born and blessed with the biggest grin in the world and always ready for a chat. CHARLES & LANDRY, should have their own show on the box, these people haven’t learnt how to be such excellent hosts, they’re born to it, nothing’s a problem and both blessed with superb senses of humour and personality. Many, many thanks Matt & Betty

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Evergreen12
Reviews.Content: We were in town for a conference, and were pleasantly surprised with how clean the hotel common areas and rooms were. The front desk staff was very polite and check in was fast and easy. We reserved a junior suite, and I was surprised at how large it was! There was plenty of room for 4 adults, and having the refrigerator and microwave was great, we took leftovers from dinner and ate them at lunch the next day (saved some money)! Great location too, the Subway (1,2,3) was right there and there were plenty of places to eat/drink nearby. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very cooperative with a cancellation and very nice room...”
Reviews.Author: pbjork52
Reviews.Content: Location was great, clean, bathroom was spotless and beautiful and the price was very good... Had to cancel one of the two days reserved because my daughter left the hospital sooner and had no problem at all... Will highly recommend to people who are looking for a hotel in the city and would love to come back again myself and see some sites in the city eventhough I do live in another boro it would be worth it to stay there for convenience. Was not sure about a parking garage if there are any discounts or free parking would like to know that... Sincerely, Pat

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MargaritaC1
Reviews.Content: A friend, my daughter and I stayed here for 5 days and were very happy with everything. We had a room with a bathroom(very important to us!) and everything was clean and comfortable. The staff was excellent; very helpful, professional and courteous. We loved the location, convenient for walking, taking the bus and the subway. We did it all! Plenty of good choices for food/dining as well. We absolutely loved Andrew's recommendation of Tandoori for Indian food, it was excellent! The meal we had a Longgrain was excellent as well and just steps outside the hotel. Thank you all for making our stay in New York so enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Very very good”
Reviews.Author: PedroPerth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in January during some pretty cold and snowy times. I was always warm & comfy in my room. I stayed for 17 nights. The location was sensational for me as I went to ALOT of shows (like 14) and being able to get from my room down to the theatre district in under 15 minutes on the subway was amazing. It was so quick & easy I was able to pop back to the hotel for naps or a break between day & night activities. The front desk men (all true gentlemen) at the hotel were some of the best I have experienced. I heard they were great which is what initially attracted me to this hotel and they were genuinely a cut above the rest. Super professional and courteous. I loved having a microwave and coffee maker in my room as I was able to eat in my room when I felt like it (I couldn't possibly eat out for 17 days straight). I bought some goodies from one of the many local supermarkets and mainly ate breakfast in my room (yoghurt, fruit, microwaved bagel). Also had some soup on standby for snacks. I particularly loved being able to have a few coffees before heading out in the morning (I am slow to get going) though I bought some instant coffee rather than using the filtered things. I had a room on the 3rd floor so always used the stairs expcept for the day I arrived and departed so did not have an issue with the lift. The wifi internet was excellent and I did not begrudge paying for it as my room rate was so good though I would rather they charge a few extra bucks for the room and include the wifi. The bathroom was clean and spacious and I was thrilled to have one after having a shared bath last trip. I have never felt more welcome and comfortable at a hotel and I almost feel "homesick". I sure hope to return. If you read my other reviews you will see I am always honest and I am honestly saying this hotel was my favourite in all my years of travelling. I stayed at a mid town supposedly funky hotel with tiny rooms the same time last year and the Newton is way better in every way.

Reviews.Title: “great value hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: grandmajan666
Reviews.Content: stayed two nights at the Hotel Newton in a Junior Deluxe Suite. Two comfortable queen beds, a small sitting area with a kitchenette (sink, microwave, and refrigerator). The rooms were clean, the bathroom updated and spotless. no signs of bedbugs. the hotel is old, and undergoing some cosmetic updates..paint and wallpaper. The elevator is small and slow...really the only negative I can think of. Conveniently located across the street from the subway, with three lines and express trains available. Short ride to Times Square and easy access to crosstown buses. Great new diner two doors down..Manhattan Diner...great for breakfast. Starbucks and Dunkin Donuts on the same block. Will definately return to the Newton

Reviews.Title: “Perfect budget hotel: excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Argentine-tourist
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed three nights in a Double Deluxe room for US $ 132 including taxes. It was excellent value for money. We cannot understand why this hotel is not rated among the top ten New York budget hotels. LOCATION: Broadway between 94th and 95th streets. Broadway is a boulevard, with uptown and downtown buses stopping a block away. The subway station 96th is half a block away. It is an express stop for trains 2 and 3 in the red line as well as the local 1 train which stops at all stations. Taking an express train from Times Square brings you to the hotel in under 8 minutes (only three express stops). From Times Square you can take the S (shuttle) subway one stop to Grand Central Station and from there you can connect with almost all the subway lines. The red line takes you all the way to the north tip of Manhattan (215th st) and the Bronx and to the southern tip of Manhattan (Wall st) and Brooklyn (directly to the Brooklyn Museum of Art). If you use the subway, as you get off you must walk to the end of the platform in search of the elevator to the Mezzanine. Once there, look for the exit to 95th st and use the elevator to get to street level. No need to lug heavy suitcases up the stairs. To the sides of the hotel you will find: two restaurants, a laundry, a pharmacy with an ATM, a gourmet deli and a newsagency and small convenience store. Opposite the boulevard is a pharmacy that develops photographs, a Chase bank with ATM, a MacDonalds. Next block, going downtown, two telephone booths for local and international calls (buy a phone card from the vending machine on the 2nd floor of the hotel: for US $ 5 I was able to speak half an hour to Argentina). Round the corner is a Gristede's supermarket with take away cooked food. Opposite the subway exit is another supermarket. Riverside Park is 3 blocks away, to walk along the Hudson River with the New Jersey coast on the other side. Central Park is 4 blocks away. If you want to go across town, to the east side, there are buses on 96th that cross Central Park. COMFORTABLE ACCOMODATION: We booked a Double Deluxe and we got it on the third floor, looking on to the back: brick building with fire escape stairs and brick wall. Two double beds, a chest of drawers on which was a coffee make, a cabinet containing the microwave and the fridge, a newly refurbished bathroom, toiletries including body lotion. The size was comfortable for two, but the room was not huge (you could step out of one of the beds and into the bathroom as there was little space between the bed and the bathroom door). However, there was a good space between the beds and the fridge and microwave cabinet, so we were able to place our two suitcases at the foot of the beds). Heating was excellent (and it was a cold February). No noise whatsoever (advantage of looking on to a brick wall). No noisy neighbours, fortunately. The LCD screen on the wall saved space and was perfectly located to watch TV from the beds. Alarm clock, telephone, good reading lights, closet with iron and ironing board. Clean. SERVICE: Reception staff friendly and helpful. We did not have any special requirements but we were pleased with the attention we got whenever we asked about something. As we left early in the morning and returned late at night, we never got to see any of the cleaning staff, but room and bathroom were always clean when we returned and the free coffee, tea, creamer and sugar/sweetener were always replenished, holding enough for 4 servings every day. ADDITIONAL COMMENTS: The hotel is suited to all budgets. We chose a mid-price option. There is a smaller ensuite room with only one double bed for a lower price, and if you are really tight, there is a room with shared bathroom for even less. If you want to splurge, there is a junior suite. You will certainly find what suits your pocket best. And you can't go wrong (provided you keep in mind that the lower the price, the smaller the room). The two computers in the lobby with internet access were always available (for US $ 1 every 5 minutes: you had to put in a $1 bill and keep adding bills according to necessity). On the 2nd floor there is an ice dispenser and a soft drink vending machine as well as the international phone card vending machine. BUDGET MINDED TRAVELLER TIPS: I cannot emphasize how important it is to have a microwave, coffee maker and fridge in the room. Eating out in New York is expensive because you must add a 8,8% tax to all menu prices + 17% (twice the amount of the tax) as tip. This means that for a $20 meal you will end up paying $25. Figure that out for breakfast too. So you get to make important savings by returning every day from sightseeing and making a stop at the supermarket to pick up your dinner and next morning's breakfast. We did not try the MacDonalds (which offered good bargains) because we preferred to try out a new dish/breakfast fare every night getting it from the supermarket. You can also try the Gourmet Deli next door. Remember to pack with you a set of fork, knife and spoon because you

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: debbied30
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The newton Hotel for 6 nights. It is located on Broadway 95th steet. It is great location 10 minutes walk to Central park, 20-30 minutes walk to time sqaure. I was in room 615 which was at the back of the hotel. The room had bathroom, towels, hair dryer, tv, fridge, micrwave, iron and iron board. The hotel staff were helpfull and friendley. The hotel is located next to plenty of place to eat. For example: Mcdonalds, Subway, Chinse,pizza shop and many more within a few minutes walking distance. When i was there the hotel was getting painted however this did not stop the guests from getting around the hotel. There is only one lift which was slow.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price”
Reviews.Author: Midwood
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Newton in early January. My daughters are in their 20's, and had a decent-size room with two queen beds. My wife and I had a small room with one queen bed. The hotel is not as nice as some we have stayed at (for example, we loved the Lucerne, but it's gotten too expensive). But you can't beat the price at the Newton for what you get : Decent rooms, friendly staff, and good location. Very close to the subway, plenty of restaurants, some interesting shops, close to Central Park, and Artie's, our favorite deli. We'd definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrispack
Reviews.Content: my friend & myself staying at this hotel beginning of Feb, really good location, room had ample space, really clean & clean towels every day of our stay . Staff was very helpful and nothing was too much for them to help your stay really good. The subway was just across from the hotel & for the location, prices to stay at this hotel was very resonable. would recommend my friends to stay at this hotel, and when i next go to new york will use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Newton is gracious, accommodating and great value”
Reviews.Author: TravelerWithOpinions
Reviews.Content: A group of ~25 of us came to NYC for the weekend and stayed at Hotel Newton. The hotel was lovely. The staff were efficient, gracious, helpful and accommodating. The rooms are comfortable and clean. Great value for the price and great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest and uncompassionate”
Reviews.Author: annadabrowski
Reviews.Content: I was supposed to stay at Hotel Newtown for 5 days in January, however, my daughter became ill and we got stuck in Buenos Aires. As I had booked the hotel through an external site, I contacted the Hotel to let them know I would be unable to stay, and to see if I could cancel my reservation, however, the hotel answered that it was impossible, so I contacted the travel agent, who told me I was unable to cancel my booking without charge, unless the hotel allowed it. I was charged for the full booking, and when I contacted the travel agency to complain, they told me Hotel Newtown claimed to 'have never heard from me', which is simply untrue, which I have the email exchanges to prove. I am a single mother with mounting medical bills for an ill toddler in Argentina and lost flights to the states which I was unable to use, and am outraged that I could be treated so badly by the hotel staff, and director, who demonstrated a complete lack of compassion for my situation. BE VERY CAREFUL ABOUT BOOKING WITH THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for no-frills travel”
Reviews.Author: Speedy71471
Reviews.Content: The location is great - right next to the 8th Ave line - and it's a good (if slightly dull) neighborhood. Rooms are small as one would expect but clean and functional. A great value for Manhattan

Reviews.Title: “Very good location, good hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Adele1980
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel on the basis of the many positive reviews found on Tripadvisor. The hotel has a very good location (ten minutes by express train from Times Square), and in general good value for money. Rooms are tiny but are spotless clean. The corridors look quite old but clean anyway. We were a bit disappointed at the desk the first day, the person assisted us quite efficiently but without a extra word, or a smile: so different from the enthusiastic reviews we had seen!
