Dealing with other staff members, though, it was much better. There's plenty of good places for breakfast around, though the diner mentioned in many reviews is still being renovated. We liked the Cafè Europa a lot. In general, we recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget choice”
Reviews.Author: Spotlight99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite with our two daughters. The suite consisted of a bedroom with 2 queen beds, sitting room with sofa, fridge and microwave, and bathroom. The room was clean and comfortable. I chose the hotel based on all the glowing TripAdvisor reviews, and the hotel was in line with expectations. We were on the third floor at the back of the building, so there was no outlook and not much natural light. On the plus side, the room was extremely quiet and we could avoid using the lift. The location was great, it's a really nice residential neighbourhood with lots of good shops and cafes. The subway is convenient and easy to use. We enjoyed our stay very much. The hotel is very good value and fine for a destination like New York where you're really only in the room to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A clean, convenient, no-frills option for the budget-conscious traveler.”
Reviews.Author: jbella9
Reviews.Content: I decided at the last minute to spend a night in New York City and wanted a low-priced but clean hotel room in a decent location. Hotel Newton fit the bill perfectly. No one should come here expecting a lot in amenities--the furniture, decor, etc. are dated (I had a tube TV in my room) but the room, linens, and bathroom were very clean. In fact, the whole place smelled faintly of soap to me, which is not a bad thing. Service was minimal, although the desk staff was perfectly friendly and helpful when I had questions. As a solo traveler, I opted for a room with a single bed--the room was VERY small but fine for purposes of just having a place to crash for the night. I can't speak to the shared bathrooms because my room had its own. I concur with the other reviewers that one of the best things about the hotel is its location at Broadway and 95th Street. It is steps away from the subway line that takes you directly to Times Square and the theater district. Penn Station is on the same line, so the hotel is super easy to get to if you are coming into the city by rail. One subway stop from the hotel and a quick crosstown bus ride will get you to the Metropolitan Museum of Art. There are plenty of cafes, drugstores, shops, etc. nearby. My only real beef was a bit of confusion over the room rate. When I called, the desk attendant said he had two options: a room with a double bed and shared bathroom, or one with a single bed and its own bathroom. I thought I heard him say he would give me either for the same price, $85 a night. I opted for the single bed, but when he transferred me to someone else to make the reservation, that person said no, the single bed was $100 a night. I told him I would see if I could get a better deal online, and lo and behold, I got the single bed for $85 a night on the hotel's own website. I have no idea what that was about, but I didn't ask because I just wanted a cheap room, not an argument. I wouldn't let that stop me from coming back, but I would definitely do my homework to get the best rate. Also, I HATE being charged for wireless internet service, and Hotel Newton charges $5.00 a day. That certainly pales in comparison to some other places, though. I'm the kind of person who would rather spend my money on seeing the sights and eating good food than on paying for expensive hotel service. If you are the same way, then the Hotel Newton is a good option for you.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly clean rooms but basic common areas and service”
Reviews.Author: baliben
Reviews.Content: I booked this room on Hotwire. 2.5 stars is a stretch. I'll start with the positives. The room was incredibly clean - especially the bathroom (good water pressure and shower head). Small but functional flat screen TV and fast wi-fi at only $5/ day. Now the negatives - The bedding looked to be on the older side and the mattress was pretty hard Some of the rooms in this hotel evidently don't have an ensuite bathroom. My room did have an ensuite bathroom but the communal facilities were right next door which made for a pretty noisy night. The corridors are extremely narrow which also contributes to the noise - there seemed to be a party in the adjacent (bathroom-less) room which lasted all night long. Also the hotel only has 1 elevator (for guests and staff) which in an 8-story building means some pretty long waits. I'd say the hotel staff were indifferent - not rude per-say but certainly not helpful either. When checking in the doorman watched me drag my suitcase through the snow and didn't even offer to help. I knew this was a bargain hotel but common courtesy should extend to all hotel classes.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel is its location, right by a subway station that makes it very easy to travel around the city. The rooms are on the smaller side but mine had a microwave and a small refrigerator. The beds are too soft and bouncy for my taste. It's an old place, and it shows in the tiny and slow elevator. The bathroom was okay but it took me forever to figure out that hot water comes out of the cold water side. Another problem, if your room is next to the shared bathroom, is the noise in the mornings with people coming in and out of the bathroom. Wireless internet was available for a fee and it worked pretty well. Staff was nice and helpful. All in all, a good place if you are on a budget and want to be in a central location.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient to subway, safe, reasonably priced”
Reviews.Author: IndyReport
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd stay. Appreciated the AAA pricing. Had room with 2 queens - nice size; clean! Subway stop across the street; delicious bagels & lox at Tal Bagels nearby; friendly staff; older hotel, nicely maintained; useful stores nearby-Duane Reade, groceries, cafés, etc. Depending on size of the room, the experience is good to excellent. Larger room made 2nd stay exceptionally nice. We plan to stay here again! Happy to say - no bedbug problem.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean lodging for my elderly parents.”
Reviews.Author: ruthnad
Reviews.Content: As I live near this hotel, I selected it for my parents (both 88), to stay when they visited us for Xmas. The room was small but clean, and the staff were very friendly and responsive to our needs. My parents said the hotel was very quiet for sleeping. The elevator is a bit slow, but you can take the stairs if you are in a hurry. It's close to the express train and everything the Upper West Side has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money with fast access to whole of Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: MatthijsAmersfoort
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we have visited this hotel mainly for the good loaction. This hotel is good value for money, the rooms are clean, the personel is friendly! On the corner are a Starbucks and a 7-11supermarket/pharmacy. The elevator, well, lets say you sometimes need some patience. Overall a recommended hotel for a city-trip NY. Taking the Express 2 or 3 subway, you are on Time Square within 10 minutes. Visiting Soho or Little Italy takes you 15 minutes in the subway (on the Express).

Reviews.Title: “Nice place in NYC”
Reviews.Author: RamakrishnaPai
Reviews.Content: New York hotels are pricey... picked this after a great deal of hunting and found it marvellous. Stayed 3 days at around $180 per day, fully worth it. The room was small but very clean and comfortable. Very nice neighbourhood, close to Central Park and just next to the subway which takes you to downtown Manhattan within 15 minutes. Several cafes and convenience stores are around. I found the single lift absolutely no problem. Nice and friendly people at the front desk. Made it an enjoyable holiday for me.

Reviews.Title: “Would never stay anywhere else in NYC. Perfect”
Reviews.Author: MandyWelwynEngland
Reviews.Content: I go to NYC twice a year and for many years stayed in midtown - but in 2005 I stayed at the Newton and have stayed twice a year since then. It is perfect, the staff, location, rooms - everything is great. Due to stay again Dec 11 2010. Will always use the Newton

Reviews.Title: “best girls weekend ever!”
Reviews.Author: Carol507
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Newton for over a week. The room was very comfortable and roomy. The staff was excellent. The local cafe's were very good and the location to the subway was at the end of the street. We saw "The Adams Family" and it was great, I would suggest the matinee. We ate at Carmine's (2 blocks from hotel not downtown) and the food was fabulous. Over all the trip was one of my favorites...

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: jamjlm
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a trip to NYC. We stayed at the Hotel Newton and it was a very good experience. Our first night we encountered a group of people, who arrived late, and were very noisy. In the morning, we asked the desk clerk to move us to a different room, which he did without any hesitation. We never had any problem after that with noise. The rooms were very clean. The Hotel Newton is in a very good location with access to the Subway, good restaurants, and within walking distance to Central Park. Hotel Newton is a moderately priced Hotel and is well worth a stay. We found the staff very, very nice. Eduardo, the Bell Captain, Landry, Andrew and Charles, Desk Clerks were so helpful. Whatever we asked of them, they were more than happy to assist. We cannot say enough about them. We will definitely stay here again when in NYC. Thanks for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “It worked but rooms were noisy”
Reviews.Author: ce_interiors
Reviews.Content: Upper West side at 94th and Broadway. 1 min from the subway which was fantastic. Close to many restaurants on Broadway and neighbouring area. Rooms were really noisy and every time a door closed you could hear it like it was being slammed. Staff were great though and the internet use although expensive was very convenient. Rooms were really small but very clean

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Mid Range Travellers - Except for the 07 row of rooms”
Reviews.Author: SimonandAngela
Reviews.Content: Arrived after 6pm at the Newton Hotel, entrance hall is clean, no door staff present. Booked in and made our way to room 307. We had booked a double room with a microwave and fridge on expedia. Our room was a lot to be desired. Tiny with a double bed providing barely enough room to roll our suitcases in. My husband went to front desk to ask where our microwave and fridge was, he was told that there were no other rooms available in the hotel and that rooms in the 07 rows were tiny and they were planning to get rid of them soon to develop a lift therefore little work had been done on them, you bet. Next thing I did was turn the shower on, guess what, it was broke. That was the icing on the cake. Simon went to reception again and was a little stronger in his approach. To our surprise a larger room became available on the next level, room 401. This room is supposed to be a queen bed, I thought it was a double and the double we should have been given in the first place. The room had fresh coffee, fridge and a microwave and a much more cleaner looking bathroom. No bed bugs present. We were much happier. The following morning we checked in with front desk that the room was for the 3 nights we planned to stay. Other than the initial blip, this hotel is clean and provides a comfortable stay in New York City. The tube station is 1 minute away, and two stops on the express to Times Square. Booking out we left our suitcases with front desk at a cost of 9 dollars. We would recommend this hotel for budget travellers.

Reviews.Title: “All that is needed”
Reviews.Author: MikeH98
Reviews.Content: Hotel Newton is a no frills hotel on 94th/Broadway. We stayed for 3 nights and were very happy with what we got... 1 Nice and safe district - no issues with walking out on the streets at night 2 Right next to the subway - 10 minutes to Times Square, 25 minutes to Lower Manhattan 3 Good choice of reasonably priced restaurants within a 5 minute walk 4 Clean and well presented room 5 Excellent value for money I've stayed in Central Manhattan before which is nice but would always choose to save $150 per night and stay a bit out of the centre. Hotel Newton is a great and convenient choice.

Reviews.Title: “Small but clean”
Reviews.Author: dansh1978
Reviews.Content: At the start of the 3 week roadtrip, i knew i would need to compromise on price when staying in New York for 4 nights. We realised the Newton was cheaper beacause it was quite far away from most things (96th St), and the room was very small. It was clean however, and located right by the subway station. There were no rooms with private bathrooms available when we booked, but hour request that we be given on if it became avaiable came to fruition, which we appreciated. Despite being relatively out of the way, there were plenty of good places for eating nearby. We especially liked the Europan Deli and Cleopatra's needle. Central Park is around a ten minute walk away. If on a modest budget as we were i would recommend it as a base.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: skinnypete63
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fantastic location, close to the subway, central park and surrounded by great little dinners and restaurants. We stayed for 7 days and it was the perfect base for our first trip to New York. The room was spotlessly clean and the much comented on elevator was not a problem. The staff were friendly and helpful and a special mention to 'Landry' who was particulary helpful. I only have one problem, the beds were terrible. If you like a firm bed then its not a problem but if you are like us, then the beds were extremely uncomfortable. We did request a thick mattress cover to soften the bedc but couldn't be accomodated. Overall this hotel is great value for money in a peaceful location and we would stay again if the bed situation changed.

Reviews.Title: “Its Repetition...And Its True”
Reviews.Author: Gingerbaker
Reviews.Content: Just back from an eleven night stay here.It was perfect for our needs.Situated right beside a subway station,this clean ,comfortable hotel was ideal. Ok, the lift is a bit slow but it really is not a problem. In a lifetime, whats a minute or two.It is reasonably priced and the staff are all very friendly and helpful. If you want busy busy stuff,5 - 10 minutes and you are in Time Square on the subway. If you want peace and lovely walks,you are situated minutes from Central Park and Riverside. Lots of good food possibilities very near the hotel or after a short subway spin.There is a bakery right across the road which is perfect for a cuppa,panina,salads and pizza. There are also diners nearby and a few decent restaurants.Hotel Newton ticked all of the boxes for us and we look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the convenience of New York”
Reviews.Author: RobRobJenJen
Reviews.Content: Located on Broadway but about 3 miles from the famous bit! 5-10 mins walk from Central Park; subway stations almost on the doorstep. About 10-15 mins by subway to Time Square. We hesitated to book this because all they had available (only 8 weeks ahead, for the end of August) was a shared bathroom – not even a washbasin in the room. We booked it on the basis of the good reviews here, which were justified, and the location. They do rooms with en suite bathrooms and we’d certainly go for one of these next time. The place was clean but just a little cramped throughout. There was only one lift, causing problems to some people (and especially the porter!) when it broke down for a few hours. There were no breakfast facilities but there are many many varied places within a short walk, and a lot of these are open 24hrs/day. (One of 8 accommodations reviewed this holiday)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for city sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: travelincomfort01
Reviews.Content: Our second stay, and hopefully not our last. I don't recognise the hotel described critically elsewhere. Friendly staff, good value and ideal location. My only criticism would be the noise of the air-con unit, but hey, that's life!

Reviews.Title: “Reluctant to let anyone know of this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mlhinuk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Newton for 6 nights in May 2010 after searching through 1000's of options on TripAdvisor. I am so glad we settled on this one. From check in to check out the service was great. Our room was was small for a "suite", it came with AC, microwave, bar fridge and a flat screen TV, plus a clean and tidy bathroom just perfect for what we needed. And the location was ideal for getting around town, the Metro, 100m away, has the 1, 2 & 3 lines. Central Park is only 3 blocks away. As this was my first visit to NYC I was very pleased with the Hotel Newton. Ok the lift is a bit slow and the stairs are a bit pokey but it is in an old building. In the absence of a restaurant there are plenty of place to eat around the hotel, the staff will give you recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel..Manhattan's hidden gem! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: vb333
Reviews.Content: Just been looking at my holiday pics from February and it reminded my that I was gonna write a review on here!! I have never written on one of these sites before, but think that the Hotel Newton is a real gem of a hotel that everyone should know about! I have stayed here on 2 occassions now, once when I was travelling to NY on my own and this year with a group of 4 friends. On both occassions, I have had a wonderful stay and found no problems with this hotel. For the price you pay, the hotel is great value. It is clean, the staff are friendly and the rooms are of a good size. This year we had a double room, which was spacious with comfortable beds, flat screen tv, coffee maker, fridge and a microwave. The bathroom was a good size and always clean, with new towels etc. The hotel does not have a restaurant or bar, but let's be honest...you don't really eat at your hotel when you have the whole of NYC to explore!!! (We did eat at the diner next door and the pancakes were fab!!) The staff are friendly and were particularly helpful during our stay as it was during the time of the snow and blizzards, and therefore our flights had been cancelled. The best thing about this hotel is the location; it is far enough away from the tourist hustle and bustle, but has a subway stop right outside which means you can be in Times Square in no time at all. It is a few blocks from the park and also located nearby are Mcdonald's, Starbuck's, a pharmacy, diner, grocers, newsagents etc. I think this is a fab hotel and have recommended it to friends and family. I would definitely stay there again. If you are looking for a no-frills, but great value hotel...then this is it!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT waste your money on this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Decoy_Grl
Reviews.Content: This place was a total dump. Considering what we paid, approx AUD250 per night and stayed 5 nights, it was very very disappointing. The elevator was from the middle ages which took about ten minutes to call up and it always went back up to the top floor even if you pushed the "down" button and the light said it was going down. The aircon unit was noisy as hell so didn't get any sleep as we had to have it on due to the warm weather. One night, we were out all day and night and came back to the room not made up. No fresh towels, nothing. The room was ridiculously small. So small, we couldn't open the closet door fully because the bedside table was in the way. And there wasn't enough room for two pieces of luggage. That's how small it was. It felt like Harry Potter's room under the stairs. The porter and concierge were helpful enough but this place is beyond redemption. Also, it had a stale, funky, musky smell that made you nauseous evertime you walked in. Overall, just not worth the money. Find somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: betty050408
Reviews.Content: We've just come back from an 8 night stay at the Newton. The room (junior suite) was huge and everything was very clean and well looked after. The staff were all friendly and helpful.There was no noise from other guests at all. The only problem was shuttle buses parked outside our window when the subway wasn't working properly for 2 nights, but that's a one off. And the lift isn't that slow, you somtimes just have to wait a couple of minutes. The location next to the subway is ideal and there are plenty of places to eat and drink in the area. I'd especially recommend The Dive Bar on Amsterdam Avenue just round the corner from the hotel. The Metro Diner up Broadway between 100th and 101st streets does a great good value breakfast. All in all, I would certainly recommend the Newton.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Shuniah80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is actually quite cute on the outside, and the lobby, while smaller, is cheerful, tidy and welcoming. The front desk staff were friendly and gave out good recommendations for restaurants and helpful directions. The elevator was a little slow but not the worst I've seen by far. We never used it during the day as we were out all day- but mornings/late evenings it was never too busy. We booked the cheapest private bathroom room, but got upgraded to the suite somehow- not complaining! It was small for a "suite", but clean and the bed was quite comfortable- the bathroom was immaculate and the AC worked fine. The suite came with a small loveseat, microwave, large-ish bar fridge and a flat screen TV. There's a 24hr pharamcy *right* next door, and the subway is only a 2 minute walk from the front doors. Lots of good dining options in the neighbourhood- or again you can hop on the subway and be anywhere pretty quickly. We were only on the 2nd floor but didn't notice any street noise. The only thing I didn't like was the charge for wifi. Long story short- it was a clean, neat relatively attractive hotel for a great price in a decent neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & decent accomodations”
Reviews.Author: robin286
Reviews.Content: I had looked around for a decent budget hotel in Manhattan and finally opted on the Newton, and am glad I did. Yes, the room was very small (partly because of the space the fridge/microwave took up), but it was certainly big enough to sleep in. This was our first experience with a "shared bath" hotel room, and it wasn't an inconvenience at all, sort of like being at home. The staff were very nice and helpful. The location was wonderful, I don't understand ANY of the bad reviews the neighborhood gets. The upper west side is beautiful and the hotel is walking distance to Carmine's and several other great eateries and the subway station's a half block away. And the elevator wasn't that bad either -- I've ridden slower! Quite serviceable -- it certainly wasn't a luxury hotel, but if I wanted luxury in Manhattan, it would have cost me about $300/night more! I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very small room, but good location”
Reviews.Author: katharina22
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. Very good location. The subway is right across the hotel (96th St) and there are a lot of restaurants in the streets nearby. Short walk to Central Park. The room is very small. We had a bedroom with shared bath. The bathroom was fancy. Because our room was right across the staff door it was really noisy, a lot of noises from the hallway too.

Reviews.Title: “Great value with convinience in Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: EagerTripper
Reviews.Content: i have a hard time trying to find the right hotel in NY as this my first time traveling to US. Luckily, i found great advice in TripAdvisor! I must say most of the reviews are quite true and accurate. We came in the early morning but we couldn't check into our hotel until noon. We left our in the locker room which we need to pay about USD5 per luggage locker. We finally check into our hotel at noon and we booked into a standard double. The size is small for 2 person but its good enough as we tour around NY the whole day. Generally, the room and the toilets are clean. The bed was alright and standard. There is many shops surrounding the hotel and its very safe. There is a starbucks across the street and provide free wifi, therefore i would advice not to pay for their wifi service if you are bringing your laptops. The hotel as most reviews have stated is just a minute away from the 96th subway station, where the express line may bring you to 42nd street (times square) just 2 stops away. There is 2 subway entrance located each side of the hotel. The pharmacy/supermarket is just next to the hotel as well. We had our breakfast across the street on the left hand side from the hotel, The European Cafe. They offer nice bagels and $4.95 for bacon and scramble eggs. Overall, the hotel provides standard and clean service. I would definitely book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for the first time visitor”
Reviews.Author: DavidWaxahachie_TX
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small but fine for two people. The fridge and the microwave are a nice added bonus. This was our first visit to New York and the location of the subways and the buses were a nice feature. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We stayed in a room with a double bed and a shared bath. Was not to sure about the shared bath but I think that we were the only ones that used the bathroom. It was always clean and stocked. We stayed on the third floor and had no view other than the other buildings but we were not in the room much and didn't care about the view because we were always out and about in the city. The lift always seemed to be mentioned a lot in the other reviews but we had no issues with it at all. Out wait times were releatively short and the hotel was very busy the whole seven days that we were there. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is a first time visitor and wants to keep the cost down. My wife and I were very impressed. Also if you have special requests be sure and e-mail them. My wife has knee problems and we requested a stay on the lowest floor possible and even though we did not book the room thru the hotel (AARP Expedia) our request was acknowledged.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, will definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: tk00
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Newton in April 2010 and it was wonderful. The staff were very helpful, and size of the room for a family of 5 (3 small children) was great. There was enough room to walk around compared to other hotels where there was only enough room for the luggages! I was impressed with the cleanliness of the hotel and the prompt service of the cleaning staff when my daughter vomitted in the room. He came up straight away and cleaned up all the mess. The location of the hotel is a big plus as it is located within short walking distance to the subway and buses. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Worst shower I've ever had”
Reviews.Author: meljoy77
Reviews.Content: Turn on the hot water, go have your breakfast and come back in 15 mins or so, the water might just be starting to warm up. Or stand there nude and cold wondering if there is any hot water at all, like I did. Finally, the trickle of water turns luke warm and you can get it, but don't expect any water pressure. The room is ok, it's quiet and there's a bed and TV and fridge so the basics are covered. The wireless internet is a joke, don't waste your money on paying for access to the terrible connection. The location is ok but if you are in New York for sightseeing, you want to be closer to midtown. Most things are a very long walk from this hotel. You'll be doing plenty of walking IN the hotel, because the lift is so slow that it's quicker to take the stairs (even if you're on the 8th floor, like I was).

Reviews.Title: “great budget hotel and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lynchCork
Reviews.Content: staff were very helpful room small but comfortable perfect location close to centeral park great resturants sybway very near would recomend this hotel to people on a budget best budget hotel on the upper west side will be back

Reviews.Title: “The Newton continues to give excellent value for the money”
Reviews.Author: BoHep
Reviews.Content: If you're looking for bath towels the size of a double bed, or fancy robes, you're better off somewhere else, but if you're looking for a clean, well-appointed, good-sized room in a hotel literally 30 steps from an express subway stop, you can't do better than the Hotel Newton. My wife, daughter and I just returned home from a five day stay (our fourth), and we love this location. Between 94th and 95th on the Upper West Side, the hotel is an easy walk from some excellent shopping, restaurants and Riverside and Central Parks, but removed from the noise and crowds of mid-town. That said, two stops (about six minutes) on the express train puts you at Times Square, and an affordable MTA pass gets you there and anywhere else in Manhattan, Brooklyn, Queens or the Bronx. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. This time we couldn't get our a/c to work (and it was about 90 and humid the day we arrived). We called down to the desk and someone from maintanence was at our door immediately, and the unit was working within five minutes. The old elevator is as slow as ever. This could be a problem for those with mobility issues. We just take the stairs. We can't wait to get back, and will definitely stay at the Newton again.

Reviews.Title: “Great, inexpensive, CLEAN hotel in a nice area, close to transportation.”
Reviews.Author: wandacleo
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. This was my second visit. The rooms are small and the elevator is admittedly slow, but the rates are very reasonable, the staff is so nice and helpful, and the rooms are very clean. The bathrooms have been redone, so they are very nice, and the rooms have refrigerators, microwaves, and air conditioners. There are all types of rooms, and some are smaller than others. My friend and I shared a room with two twin beds. The size was adequate since we basically just slept there--and way cheaper than anything else I've found. The bus and subway stops are within 1/2 block, and the area is safe at night, so we took the bus home after the theater with no problem. There are lots of good restaurants (Longgrain, Telio, Popover cafe, City diner) within a few blocks--on Broadway and Amsterdam. I can't wait to visit again. Internet was $5/night, but considering the price of the rooms, that was ok.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value, but small rooms”
Reviews.Author: DuFFi_SK
Reviews.Content: The Newton hotel is good situated. It is 10 seconds walking distance from the metro station (96th station). There are McDonalds and Starbucks near the hotel. The rooms are ok - clean, (equipped with microwave, coffee machine, TV, air conditioning, fridge, iron and hair dryer) BUT they are very small. Quality of sleeping was average, because the air conditioning was loud and the bed was not very comforable. Wireless internet was not complimentary and we paid also for luggage lockers in the luggage room. But globally I would recommend this hotel, because of good situation and price. I know - it is pretty expensive, but it is still less expensive than lots of other hotels in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: ljs2010
Reviews.Content: You cant beat the location. Steps from the subway and many great restaurants and shops. The building is old and during the heat wave that I was there the air conditioner got a big workout but it was clean and quiet. The staff were nice and friendly even after I left and had an issue with my credit card company. Big Thanks to Emilio for his quick help.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: philcanko
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Manhattan. I must say that the whole experience was worth all the blisters my kids and I got on our feet from doing a lot of walking. I have to say that our stay at Hotel Newton is quite an experience on it's own. My arrival did not look very good because of the problem with the subway system. We could not unload our luggages in front of the hotel because the city is using the front of the hotel to transfer passengers from the subway. Other than that, everything else is good. We spent too much time exploring the city that when we get back to our room, all we wanted to do was rest for the night and get ready for our next day activities. After the first day, the noisy AC unit did not bother us at all. It actually probably help dampen down the noise from the street, if there are any. The elevator was never an issue for us because of the hours we got in and out of the hotel. It's also nice to see that they are doing some kind of renovation when we were there. The cleanliness of the unit and the size of it, makes it all worth it. The small fridge, microwave and coffee maker in our unit is also a big plus for me. The staff are very friendly, make's it even more pleasant place to stay. And I need not mention that the subway is but few feet away from the door of the hotel, this makes going home late very convenient. I definitely will not hesitate to recommend this hotel to any of my friends!!!...

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: hinkgen
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night trip to NY in which we staye at the Hotel Newton. For the $$ it is a very decent place to stay (we paid just $175 direct through their website) for a 2 queen bed "suite". By NY standards, the room was large. It was nice and clean and plenty up-to-date. We had a micro and fridge, which were really handy for keeping breafkast foods at the ready. The hotel had an incredibly handy location with the subway so near. Noise was no issue as we had the a.c. on constantly. No view from our room, but who cares? Staff were friendly and helpful. The hotel was a steal, but don't expect superior quality. The towels and sheets are total very thin, the elevator stinks; we were on the 9th floor (we NEVER rode it down except for the last day w/ our luggage). Internet is $5 a day, but very reliable. They will store your bags in secured lockers, but you must pay about $5 for each locker (we needed two for four suitcases). We only had one complaint that might cause us to not return...but we honestly never brought it to the attention of the management. The a.c. had a total funky (musty) odor. It bugged me more than the rest of our family, and we liked the roominess of the room, so didn't want to have to swap rooms for another.

Reviews.Title: “Kind of scary”
Reviews.Author: vacationmama
Reviews.Content: This hotel is exactly what it is billed to be - a two star hotel. I don't stay in two star hotels, but the great reviews here led me to try it, plus the close proximity to Columbia. Not quite sure why there are all these great reviews. For a little more $$, one can stay in a much nicer hotel in a safer area. I stayed for one night for a quick visit to Columbia with my teenage sons and would not return. We had two rooms, one was billed as a suite. Really tiny. The hotel is very old, the decor is really old, the rooms are small and dark. The air conditioner (which is attached to the window and old) made so much noise it was difficult to sleep. The view out of the windows is into a dark alley and an ugly buidling next door. I will say that the rooms are clean and the staff was nice. The bathrooms have been updated. However, I felt uncomfortable and unsafe during my stay. It has a very "seedy" feel to it. I saw one of the staff very thoroughly check out my as yet undeveloped 13 year old daughter. If you have young girls in your party beware, Yuk.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Cathy_Cl
Reviews.Content: The Newton is excellent value for money. The standard rooms are a bit old fashioned in their decoration and they aren't too big but there's enough space for suitcases and putting items away. They were cleaned thoroughly every day and they all have AC which comes in handy during NY's hottest summer ever. The bathrooms are really nice and spacey though I'd adivse to bring your own hairdryer, the one they have barely does anything. Location-wise it is situated right by a subway station where three different lines stop and a block away from another subway station right by Central Park where another 3 lines make a halt. The express trains make sure you can get to Times Square in just 5 minutes, so it's easy to head downtown. Plus, since it's not located in or near the very city center, it means you actually get a good night's sleep. We had no problems with noise of any kind. There are two computers in the lobby that can be used to go online (1$ for 5 minutes or 5$ for 20) and the staff at reception is friendly. Right across the street is a Starbucks and a European Bakery café where you can eat anything you might want for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than the competition”
Reviews.Author: XchocolateX
Reviews.Content: For the past few years I had been staying at their partner hotel 20 blocks south on Broadway. Everything was fine. The decor was very attractive, the room was very comfortable with good storage space; you don't have to live out of your suitcase. The room had a good size refrig, micro and ironing board and iron. I thing that it would be nice if they upgraded the towels. The washcloths were like sand paper

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and unhelpful”
Reviews.Author: JM56044
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. My family booked three rooms separately to meet up in New York and asked for twin rooms. Despite booking and paying up front two months before and asking for the rooms to be near each other, our requests were ignored. When we asked at the desk on arrival, we were told dismissively that as we booked through Expedia our requests would not be met. We ended up in double rooms, with my grown son and daughter having to share a bed, and each room as far apart as possible on the 2nd, 5th and 9th floors. The double rooms are tiny with no room to swing a mouse let alone a cat! The desk staff clearly did not care and acted as if this was a normal situation. It probably was as each morning we heard people at the desk asking to switch rooms. On a trip to the USA which saw us staying in many excellent good value hotels, the Newton was by far the worst and least value for money. Do not book this Hotel through an agency as you will be given the least priority in allocation of rooms and will not get what you think you have booked.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: npfiii
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Newton for 10 nights (once we found it; the cab driver drove straight past due to the scaffold outside blocking the signs) and were thoroughly delighted with it. Check in was a breeze thanks to the friendly, efficient staff who always had a cheery greeting when we left or entered the place. The room (7th floor) was more than big enough for the two of us, and was spotlessly clean every day. The aircon was slightly louder than we are used to, but as we stayed during a heatwave it served its purpose well, and kept the room nice and cool. Good sized bathroom, with plenty of hot water and good pressure (handy when we were returning to shower and change two or three times a day thanks to the heatwave) The Microwave and fridge hardly got used, but came in handy when they were. Somewhat disappointingly, the Key West Diner next door had just closed for renovations (if you look at other reviews, this place gets brilliant reviews and comes recommended by the Newton), but the hotels location meant there were several alternatives nearby, including the City Diner (Key West's sister establishment) a few blocks south, however, if you leave the hotel, turn left and go one block there is a great food cart that does the best egg and bacon rolls, along with other things, for $3 - a great way to start the day. The lift has been mentioned numerous times in other reviews and, perhaps, rightly so. It was quite slow to get to your floor, didn't hold a lot of people, and was out of order one morning; granted it was fixed quickly, but we had a several storey hike down the stairs. There's probably not a lot the hotel can do to upgrade the lift, so while it was a slight downside to the stay, it's not something anyone should look at when considering a stay here. Internet access is available for a fee ($4.95 per day if memory serves) which, when a lot of hotels now offer this for free, smacked a little of 'penny pinching', but once connected the wireless was one of the more stable connections we've had in a hotel. The location was a double-edged sword for me, as there was a subway station half a block away (1,2 and 3 lines) and a couple of bus stops nearby but returning to the hotel (after shopping, or for the aforementioned shower/change pitstop) took longer than what we would have liked, or if we had stayed more midtown. This can't be considered a criticism however, as it reflects more on what we wanted to see and do, which seemed to be more in the south of the island/in Brooklyn, so we maybe should have considered location more carefully. If you're looking for a hotel outside of the usual 'touristy' areas, then you'll be hard pressed to find a better place. We would consider staying there again, if for nothing else for the promise the chap behind the counter gave when we handed over a couple of Metro cards that had a few days left to run on them, should any member of staff be able to make use of them; he said he'd do a little dance for us the next time we stayed - something we will be holding him to :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Member From Shellharbour Australia
Reviews.Content: The Newton Hotel fully deserves the reputation for being top value in NYC. After a lot of research, we chose the Newton for 2 stays in June 2010. I wont go into all of the advantages as they are many, and well documented in other reviews. We had a junior suite on the 8th floor for a week, and one on the 4th floor next to Broadway for 3 days. Both were a good size and very confortable, but had slightly different characteristics. The 8th floor room was better designed, but the A/C was very loud. We couldnt turn it off as it was hot and humid in NY at the time. However, it did had an advantage. The room was not very soundproof, so it drowned out the noise of the hallway and other guests. The 4th floor room was not laid out as well, but the A/C was a lot quieter and the location at the end of the hall was also a lot quieter. I was aware of the lift situation before I booked. I used it as a character building excercise and tried to think of the money I saved staying here, but I have to admit that after 1 week of putting up with it, I was a bit fed up. The lift is slow and is busy often enough to require tolerance. However, it is not enough to stop me from staying again. Overall, despite some minor little things (and the lift,) the Newtown has so much going for it (especially location and price), that I would happily come back again. Would recommend a junior suite at the end of the hall on a lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, decent rooms"”
Reviews.Author: Tiffanista
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in 4 or 5 star hotels, but was on a tight budget and needed something decent for 13 nights while taking workshops at Teacehrs College at Colubia University. It was 3 stops away by subway from the college. The subway entrance is extremely close to the hotel. The room is clean, but very small. Smaller than the tiny hotel rooms I stayed at in Italy, but it served it's prupose for two women sharing it for a few weeks. The maids keep the place tidy. The air conditioning worked very well as we were there during a heat wave. the staff downstairs was always helpful in letting us know which subway to take to all the tourists spots. It walking distance from Central park and surrounded by every eatery you can think of. Banks, Starbucks and a grocery store all on the same block. The price was good for what we got. I would stay on the 2nd floor or as close to the lobby as possible as the elevator is small and got stuck often. fridge, microwave and coffee pot came in handy in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Mouldy room, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: ljm061
Reviews.Content: Would not recommend this hotel. We were put in a twin when we requested a double (others in our party checking in on a different day requested twins and got doubles, which are tiny). The one lift was broken on arrival. 9 flights of stairs are not fun and there was no offer to help us with luggage. Our first night was in a room that stank of mould - the wall paper was peeling off and was black underneath - and the floor was oddly wet. We were moved to another room the next day and got the impression this wasn't uncommon. The staff were - with one or two exceptions - unhelpful. It might be cheap, but it certainly isn't cheerful!

Reviews.Title: “Good value and very well located”
Reviews.Author: Rosie55Surrey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an overnighter on arrival in New York... No frills budget hotel with minimal serv ices but very good customer service - it was exactly as described . Had a fridge, microwave and coffee maker which was very useful. Air conditioned as well. Very well placed for the subway and sightseeing

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for your money”
Reviews.Author: jflafond
Reviews.Content: Located just in front of a subway station (this is priceless), within easy walking distance of central park, the Newton has small, but very clean rooms. Service was very good, there really is nothing to complain about. You must realize that this is not a luxury hotel and the rooms are pretty small. I only say this because I saw some people complaining about that. If you are looking for a big suite, go to the Hilton and pay 10 times what this place costs! There is a small convenience store, an ice cream place, a really good diner (great for breakfast and the lemon pie is insanely huge and good) and an also really good thai/japanese restaurant all located right beside the hotel. This was VERY convenient for us. There are 2 reliable and safe inside parkings at the corner of the street (1 minute walk) if you come to the city with your car. The neighborhood feels safe even late at night and is surprisingly quiet. I will definitely go back to the Newton next time I am in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel for the price!”
Reviews.Author: love2travel2x4
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed in a Junior Suite for 5 nights. The room was big and clean. We had 2 double beds a sofa, and a little kitchen area with a dining table and chairs, fridge and microwave. Our room faced onto Broadway and wasn't too noisy. The lift was very slow and hot but there is allways the stairs. The staff were pleasant although we didn't ask for much. The metro is 2 mins walk away and gets you to Times Square really quick, we went on the bus once for a change and to see some scenery and it took an hour! There is a supermarket a few doors up, and lots of diners whci have cheap breakfasts. It;s a nice walk to Central Park. We hailed a cab right out front of the hotel on several occasions. It took just 40 minutes to get from JFK to Hotel Newton on a Sunday evening and cost $45 + $5 toll + tip, same deal on way back on a Friday afternoon and only took 40 minutes again. Would recommend this hotel especially for familes as could not find anything better or cheaper and for the price we were nicely suprised.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel- Reviews are accurate but don't ask for a cab!”
Reviews.Author: TravelNinja2010
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with the many reviews on this site. The hotel location is great, right next to the subway and in a good neighborhood. Hotel is very clean. There is only one elevator that is really old and slow and hot, not awful but not great- take the stairs if you can. The room was very small but delivered on what was promised- double bed, flat screen tv, microwave, fridge, dresser, desk and private bath- not much room to walk around. The bed was ridiculously firm. Service was fine, we didn't have much interaction with the staff other than checking in and out. The diner next door is typical but service is lacking- eat somewhere else. My only issue was on our last day, we called the front desk to get a cab. I was told the ride would be $65 to go to the airport (JFK) even though the ride to the hotel was only $45 plus tolls and tip (tolls were $5.50). The cab the hotel called was a private cab not a NYC yellow cab so the price was higher- I had to ask, the information was not shared with me. We were unsuccessful hailing a cab on our own outside so we just went with it. I asked again about the price and the front desk assured me the cost was $65 flat. We get into the cab and pull away to find out the cab was actually $70 plus tolls and tip. I told the driver what the front desk told me and he got upset stating "This is why I hate picking up from this hotel because they don't tell the truth." He proceeded to tell us this wasn't the first time this had happened and that the hotel actually charges him $10 to pick up people from the hotel (we saw him go in to pay the desk so I don't think this was a lie). We could've jumped out and hailed a yellow cab but the price of two cabs would've been about the same, so we just dealt with being ripped off. Then I asked to be sure the cab took credit then he informed me it would be an additional 10% fee to use a card. Ugh! The driver was nice enough to pull over at an ATM so I could get cash and avoid the fee. I just wish the hotel was more up front with us. I'm sure the hotel would blame the driver but I really felt like the driver was legit. Anyway- give yourself extra time and walk 5 blocks to hail a yellow NYC cab- save yourself the cash and stress. I recommend this hotel if you can't really afford anything else. We picked it for the price and the fact we didn't have to share a bathroom. I wouldn't stay there again if I could afford something else (with a private bathroom).

Reviews.Title: “Just seconds to the subway and it's only minutes ride to Times Square”
Reviews.Author: AussieTravellers75
Reviews.Content: We can't deny that this hotel presented value for money in New York. The location is pretty good - just seconds to the subway and it's only minutes ride to Times Square. It's nice that its away from the hustle and bustle too and has lots of restaurants in the local area to choose from. Although there did tend to be a lot of noise generally speaking. The microwave and fridge in the room are great too - providing some more affordable options for eating. The staff were friendly and accommodating with any questions we had. Definitely a no frills option.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice location, really value for your money”
Reviews.Author: PKa
Reviews.Content: Stayded at the Newton for 6 nights on June 2010. The location is excellent with lots of restaurants and cafes near by and the subway, really, at the door. With express train (1 or 2) it takes 5 minutes to get to Times Square. Rooms are nice, not luxurious, but then again, you are not paying luxury prices either :) But the room was very, very clean, had a microwave and fridge so you could keep your drinks cold :) All in all very nice hotel and would recommed it to everybody. The only thing I didn't like was the preauthorization, take make a hold to your credit card for the whole amount at the check-in and lift that when you check-out and then make the actual charge. No problem, if we would have known that before, but this came as a suprise. It didn't really cause any real trouble, but it is sort of annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for good price”
Reviews.Author: FamilyHemsted
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with the hotel - the room was PERFECT for us - 4 "girls" (Mum, one teenager and two 22 year olds) - roomy and clean. The guys on the reception were really friendly and helpful. The diner right next door was perfect for breakfast. The location was brilliant because it was only 2 stops on the express subway into Times Square (about 10 minutes)and the subway was right opposite the hotel. Also the hotel was a 5 minutes walk away from Central park. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Everything you need in a NYC hotel”
Reviews.Author: funinthesunWPG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Newton with my mother, aunt, and cousin for a week in June. We had a room with two queens and a private bathroom and it turned out to be a great stay for many reasons. Our rooms were always really clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The hotel's location is pretty close to perfect - the subway is outside the lobby and you're minutes away from Times Square by train. Central Park is a few short blocks away, and there are dozens of restaurants to choose from. We ate Broadway Bagel a few blocks up the street (around 101st Street) several mornings which was really reasonable for breakfast. Lots of banks and pharmacies in the area too. I don't really know what else a NYC vacationer could ask for in a mid-priced hotel - based on my experience, the Hotel Newton is a fabulous place to stay, especially considering the little time you do spend in your room while in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: gefilte63
Reviews.Content: The Newton is a great deal for the price. The location is good--in a safe neighborhood with many restaurants, shops, etc., and right next to the 96th St. 1, 2, 3 subway lines. The real standout is the staff who are all friendly--from the front desk to housekeeping to maintenance. This is not the Waldorf Astoria, but for the price it is a clean, nice-sized room in a good area.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Manhattan Hotel; great location”
Reviews.Author: WeloveNYC
Reviews.Content: Me and my hubby have just returned from a week's holiday in NYC and we stayed at the Hotel Newton. We got a great deal off Expedia and because we selected a room with a shared bathroom meant we were able to enjoy 7 nights in our favourite city. The hotel is a 'blink and you miss it' from the outside but it has a lovely lobby and entrance and the rooms are very comfortable with the added bonus of a microwave and a full sized fridge. We also had a flat screen TV in our room. The shared bathroom wasn't an issue in the main and was impeccably clean, as was the rest of the hotel, but towards the end of our stay, there was an inconsiderate guest who left the bathroom in a less than desirable state. Perhaps the hotel may display a sign advising all guests to leave facilities in the way they too would expect to find them. Our room was cleaned and we were given fresh towels daily. The housekeeping and maintenance staff work extremely hard and are more than happy to help with storing your luggage on the day of departure. The hotel is conveniently located on the 1, 2, 3 subway line and 96th street stop is located almost directly outside the hotel. The best money we invested during our week stay was a 7 day unlimited subway pass for $27 - we certainly got our monies worth and travelled all over Manhattan, walked across the Brooklyn Bridge and jumped on the subway home. The 2 train is the express train so you can be down in Times Square in just a few minutes and the 1 train stops at all stops on the line. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay here again but this time we may save a few more pennies so that we can enjoy our own bathroom. Hope you found the review useful and informative.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would definitely stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: cma_6
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. You have the metro station minutes away, as well as Mcdonalds, Starbucks, Wall greens and Dunkin Donuts. Central is also within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and helpful and made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean hotel with a good location.”
Reviews.Author: Elaine611
Reviews.Content: We stayed overnight (3 adults) this past weekend. We had 2 queen-sized beds. The room was large and clean. Would have liked a bathroom counter for our toiletries though. Also, they only had a sheet and comforter on the bed. Would have liked a blanket on top of the sheet, since I won't use the comforter. There was a refrigerator and microwave in the room. I would have liked the air-conditioner to be a little more powerful, since it was a hot weekend. The price was good and the location was very good, for what we were doing. We would probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for your money”
Reviews.Author: Alexuvic
Reviews.Content: I went to the Newton for a whole week of New York tourism. I was led to this hotel by the reviews shared over here and I was not disappointed. I had one of the rooms with a shared bathroom, and it was really clean over the entire time. The housekeeping is great, and it almost reaches up to our European standards which is good news. The reception is always really helpful and welcoming. You can also enjoy the good connection via the metro station in front of the door. Unfortunately, you have to pay 5 Dollars for wireless each day. This has said differently in other reviews. You can survive that though. Overall, this is a goo deal

Reviews.Title: “Great Place on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: jkr_on_the_web
Reviews.Content: While the Newton is not really a budget place, I'd still recommend it to New York travelers, especially the ones visiting the city the 1st time. It's worth the money. Great neighborhood, not too close to the very touristy center, with all that being easily to reach from the nearby subway station. Great staff, the rooms are OK for NYC. Be sure to book and pay via your local travel agent to not be unpleasantly surprised by NY overnight/room/[insert_another_tax_here] surcharges, yet the hotel is not to be blamed for that. WLAN ($5/24h) was OK, yet a bit cumbersome sometimes (e.g. Skype was even unreliable with plain text messages exchanged with a friend in Boston)

Reviews.Title: “Great as Usual”
Reviews.Author: BeardieDallas
Reviews.Content: We've stayed there well over a dozen times and never been disappointed by the room, staff or price. Over the years, the rooms have been upgraded (and the price increased) always offering good value. The staff is g-r-e-a-t. Over the past half decade, they're still there. That says a lot. If you think fronting on Broadway may be too noisy, ask for a quiet room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, across road to Subway”
Reviews.Author: ExeterStewie
Reviews.Content: The hotel was cheap for New York. We stayed here as it was close to our friends. The room itself was very small. Bathroom was nice and new, Rooms contained fridge and microwave. Room seemed to either be very hot or with the air-con on very cold - not really a happy medium so not the best sleep on that basis. We did see into one of the twin rooms and that looked a lot more spacious. Staff were really helpful and friendly. Gave good pointers on booking shows and travelling around using the subway. They also had 3 maps - a city one, a bus one and a subway one which were useful. The subway is actually opposite the hotel as is McDonalds!! There are lots of nice and reasonable restaurants around the hotel if you're not wanting to head into town every night. Mama Mexicos up the road is definitely worth a visit if only to try the guacamole. Really good buzzy atmosphere and good food.

Reviews.Title: “YES”
Reviews.Author: chaser12_10
Reviews.Content: BEST LOCATION EVER. subway stop right down the street! starbucks, tim hortons, mcdonalds, duane reade, tastee delite all within the block. HANDY!!! safe! really helpful staff. slow elevator if you need it, but it was fine. really close to tom's restaurant featured (exterior only) on seinfeld! and columbia. i believe jerry stiller and his wife, anne meara, live nearby on the upper west side. celebrity spotting!!!! best value in manhattan! and very clean!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: richnindy
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not fancy, but it is impeccably clean, and it is by far the largest hotel room in New York I have ever encountered. And at this price! Great bathroom. Nice flat-screen TV. And the location is probably the very best part -- practically across the street from the Metro station. Such a gift after a long day of walking. Oh, and the service -- very helpful and friendly staff. So the downside? The location is not all that great. We are accustomed to staying downtown and wanted a change but just found ourselves spending a lot of time on the subway. There is a lot of stuff around, but to get to anything interesting requires walking number of blocks. Even Central Park is several blocks away. And yes, we were on Broadway, and the noise was quite annoying. Let me be honest: it is not loud and it is not constant, but the trucks backing up, the alarms going off, the occasional noise wakes you up all night long. And if the room is stuffy (as our was)? The window air conditioner is extremely loud. And while we're on the noise . . . the walls are not particularly thin, and one morning we woke up (early) to the neighbor's plumbing and another morning (early) to the neighbor's TV. All in all, a really excellent value and well-run hotel, but in the future, we will probably stay closer to downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay @ newton”
Reviews.Author: Netherlands_10
Reviews.Content: Just arrive back from 6 nights. We had a larger room (4 persons - 2 double beds) than we had reserve (1 double). So we had more than enough space. I think they really have a good cleaning staff, because the rooms are really clean. The location is super it is a small 10 min. walk to the park or the hudson. We went to see Times Square and i think it is crazy to stay there! The neighbourhood of the hotel is i think quit expensive. It is thank god not full with hotels. Broadway is busy but if you take a side street than you are in a quite people living neighbourhood. With metro (2 and 3 are really fast) you are so in a other place of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Spotlessly Clean”
Reviews.Author: pollyg40
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Newton for 6 days at the end of April. When we arrived we were welcomed by Eduardo who took our cases. We were checked in and shown our room straight away. It was a large room with views onto Broadway. Everywhere was exceptionally clean and it was good having a coffee maker, fridge and miicrowave in the room. The bed was comfy and the water in the bathroom was always nice and hot. All the staff were very friendly and a pleasure to talk to. The hotel is perfectly located for catching the metro, which is the best way to travel into town and is also very cheap. We never waited more than 5 minutes for a train, and within 10 minutes we were in 42nd Street, and in 20 minutes we were in Wall Street. It is also perfectly positioned for walking to Central Park, which is absolutely fantastic. The Key West Diner next door is a great place to eat, again with friendly staff and quick service, although there are loads of other places to eat all within a short stroll. We would definately recommend The Hotel Newton, and hope to go back and stay again on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Newton is too good...but it really IS true!”
Reviews.Author: packed2travel
Reviews.Content: The pictures on the website do not lie. The great reviews previously posted do not lie. Hotel Newton is awesome value for a great price, all wrapped up in a great package in a wonderful location! We booked with the Newton after reading reviews on TripAdvisor and, even before we got there, the service we got from the manager was above and beyond. We were given an even better room than we asked for, and couldn't believe our luck. Besides the terrific room, there was a subway station nearly on our doorstep, everything we needed on the same street including a fabulous 24 hr. hotel. Thanks for making New York even better for us!!

Reviews.Title: “Quite perfect !”
Reviews.Author: dizzitelli
Reviews.Content: Hi, I spent 8 nights in this hotels with my girlfriend, we was at the room 901, at the last floor of this hotel. The room was well furnished with wardrobe, microwave, iron and refrigerator. We had a really good permanence in this hotel. If I really have to find negative aspects they surely were the elevator and the front desk staff. The first works really bad for a hotel with 9 floors and the front desk staff was not really kind (as new yorkers style...), but I've pointed both this aspects to the Hotel and they have promises me that they will work soon on this defects. Anyway I recommend it to all expecially because it's located in a very quite zone of the city, well organized and really next to the subway. I can say that things because a few day after, when we came back to New York, after a trip to Washington DC, we spent two nights in an other hotel in the theatre district (49th with 8th) and it was a terrible experience comparing with Hotel Newton. Hello everyone Domenico

Reviews.Title: “Clean, well-equipped, and good location.”
Reviews.Author: abcdxyz
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in March-April, 2010. I chose the Hotel Newton partially because of the rave reviews in TA. While I wouldn't go over the top to the extent that many reviewers have, I had a good experience at the Newton. I had a Superior Double room, which was probably the smallest hotel room I had ever been in (my first time in NYC; I understand that's the norm there). The room was very clean, and was straightened up daily. The bed, while kind of hard, was OK, and I slept fine (after walking all day!). I had plenty of clean towels and soap and shampoo. The bathroom was obviously recently renovated, and the sink, toilet, and bathtub were very nice and new. Again, the bathroom was very clean. I really enjoyed having a fridge, microwave, and coffeemaker. The staff were all very courteous when I interacted with them (I don’t seem to spend as much time talking to the staff as some other reviewers do). The neighborhood seemed quite safe, although I didn’t walk around at night. The Key West diner next door has good food and I ate several meals there. The Duane Reed on the other side of the hotel not only has drugstore items, but also has a fairly extensive food selection. The 96th St. subway station is close, which allowed me to get up or downtown easily, and there is also a crosstown bus on 96th St. that goes across Central Park to the Upper East Side and Museum Mile. Overall, I’d say the Hotel Newton is a good hotel at a fair price in this overpriced hotel market. I'm glad I stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “i like very much”
Reviews.Author: BrazilNiCuca
Reviews.Content: good location, near subway, perfect room with facilities like microwave and refrigerator; very clean and a good price

Reviews.Title: “What can I say? I'm glad we stayed at the Newton!”
Reviews.Author: gnup2
Reviews.Content: I was travelling with a friend, we've known each other for 30 years. Nevertheless, we want separate beds, so I sent an e-mail requesting just that. Within a day, I got a reply saying we were upgraded to a superior room with 2 queen beds. Upon arrival we entered a spacious room with... 2 queen beds. A clean and recently renovated room I might add! This was my 4th stay in New York, sleeping at 'budget' hotel everytime (think Wolcott and Pennsylvania), but the Newton was my best choice so far. The location is OK, good places to eat within walking minutes and a Starbucks across the avenue. I personally think their coffee is way overrated and way too weak, but hey, if you like it, it's there. Subway is only 1,5 blocks away, which is convenient. No downsides? Well, if your room is on Broadway, be prepared for a lot of street noise. And if you're in a hurry to get up to your room, take the stairs, as there is only 1 lift.

Reviews.Title: “Best New York hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevanne
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January this year, our first trip to the USA. What a find. No-one bothered us, we came and went at leisure. Cooked our own porridge every morning in our microwave. Gave us a great start on those freezing NY January mornings. The price was right, the location fantastic, close to the subway, right next door to The Key West Diner for meals, a pharmacy/ mini mart on the other . It had to be the cleanest hotel we have EVER stayed in. I cannot fault anything. Just stay here, you will see for yourself!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: auburnwilly
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my 18 year old son while we were looking at schools. I got a suite with 2 queen beds and a bathroom in the room. The price from the hotel website was cheaper than any of the online sites I found for the same room. The room was great. The bathroom was really nice tile. The beds were comfy. There is a subway stop a half a block away. Lots of great restaurants in the area. My son was happy, he could watch TV late at night without bugging me. I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE HOTEL GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: MikeB_9
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Newton Hotel for a first visit to New York Located on the Upper West side of Manhattan you can easily jump on the subway to visit all the attractions. Central Park is very close by. The area is very safe and fashionably upmarket. Hotel represents great value for money. The room was great; I suspect we were upgraded. One particular feature of note is how clean the hotel was. Good staff. To be honest for the price you cant fault it.

Reviews.Title: “So good, I'm going back!”
Reviews.Author: navantravel
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2007 with my sister, mother and aunt and I have to say, we had an excellent time. The location was very convenient to the metro stops and the few taxi journeys we took from downtown back to the hotel weren't all that expensive. My mother isn't a great walker so this was perfect for her and my aunt who loves to walk, loved being able to stroll around to Central Park each morning. The local fruit and veg and deli shops on the nearby street corners were fantastic, as we could stock up our fridge in the room for breakfast. With 4 women in NYC and a lot of shopping, having a decent size room was imperative and we weren't disappointed. We also found the area to be quite safe, we went walkabout on our first night to find our feet, and were probably strolling around past midnight and didn't feel remotely nervous. I'm going back now with my boyfriend, his 1st time to NYC, and am a little apprehensive about how the hotel might have changed and whether it will be as good as I remember it to be, but fingers crossed! All I remember is the helpful staff and the oh-so comfortable beds! Looking forward to seeing my favourite city again!

Reviews.Title: “All the good reviews are justified.”
Reviews.Author: telboyo1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in February, the hotel is in an excellent location very close to the subway. The en-suite room was a decent size for New York and well appointed with a large fridge(not a "mini-bar" )and microwave. Despite other reviews commenting on the slowness of the lift (elevator) we found it as fast as any other if you remember to press the "door close" button after selecting the floor. One day after returning to the hotel we mentioned to the front desk that the hair dryer was not working, within 2 minutes of reaching our room maintenance were there to replace it. Excellent service and very fairly priced hotel for Manhattan, I would recommend this to any one who wants a friendly independent in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful find on the Upper West Side”
Reviews.Author: NPOConsultant
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights on business. Room was large, clean, well-appointed, and quiet. Nice bathroom with new fixtures. Wireless internet, flat screen tv, small coffee maker. Front desk staff very helpful. Junior Suite for $100 a night was simply a steal.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Upstate_traveler_HH
Reviews.Content: Traveled mid-week, with two kids in tow. Hotel is located in the Upper West Side, right on the subway, 7 stops away from 42nd street, very easy to do. Parking is available around the corner, with discount from the hotel ($27 / 24hrs). Plenty of dining options within a couple of blocks. Hotel is not new or newly remodeled; however it is well kept, and provides all basic, modern amenities one can expect. Our room was a double queen suite; we found it to provide plenty of space and did not miss anything. Beds were quite firm (OK by me), and there was no view from the window (not necessarily bad, because it was quiet). There was a fragrance from the cleaning supplies throughout the hotel, including in our room, that we could have done without, but it was not a deal breaker. Upon our arrival, we were given a room that really smelled of a strong perfume, and we asked for a different room. The receptionist gave us a different room (608) right away. This type of service was typical throughout or stay: the staff were courteous and helpful with any questions and requests we had. There are many other hotels closer to Times Square, and we will probably try another one next time, but if you are looking for a good value and amenities, this hotel should be at the top of your list.

Reviews.Title: “Fanastic, Fantastic, Fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: kirstie83
Reviews.Content: We went to New York as a present for my Moms birthday in Dec 2009. This was our first time to New York. We booked the Newton as the reviews seemed good, location was good and the price was in our budget. Before booking I emailed the hotel on several occasions regarding the room sizes as we needed a room for me and my husband and a seperate room for my mom. On every occasion that I emailed,the reservations manager responded very quickly and I was very impressed with the service. We booked 2 superior double rooms. We arrived at the Newton approx 6pm on the evening and was greeted by Landry and Charles who were very friendly and helpful. We went up to our rooms and was very impressed with the cleanliness and size and it had all amenities we could need including fridge, microwave, coffee maker and TV. The bathroom was a decent size, very clean and had a lovely shower. Maid service everyday, beds were comfy and rooms were warm. Ok, so there wasn't much of a view but we were only in the room to sleep and get ready and the rest of the hotel made up for this. The reception area was welcoming with internet and was decorated nicely. As it was christmas, we wanted to go and see the tree at Rockefella Centre so Landry pointed us the right direction telling us where to get on the subway and where to get off. The subway was very close and convenient and we used this every day to take us to Times Square (42nd St). The Subway journey was approx 5 minutes. Next to the hotel was Key West Diner. This Diner was fantastic. Service was excellent and we ate in here every morning for breakfast and had an evening meal. All food was lovely. The waiters and waitresses were very friendly and by the 2nd day, they knew our breakfast order!!! Whilst in New York we purchased the city Sights 3 day bus pass. This was excellent and value for money. You could hop on/hop off the bus wherever you wanted and had a tour guide on every bus telling you all about New York and the places you were passing. The pass also included free entrance to Top of Empire State Building, statue of Liberty and Ellis Island along with some money off vouchers for shows and restaurants. The ticket is purchased from men in yellow coats who are all over the place in Times Square. The hotel is conveniently located with shops, restaurants, 24 hr drug store and snack bars all outside the door. It is also within walking distance to Central Park. Overall, we had a fantastic time in New York and would definately return. It was all we imagined it to be and more. We hope to return next Summer and will 100% be staying at the Hotel Newton. Fantastic! Thank you for a magnificent trip and for making my moms birthday so perfect as New York was her dream holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid room 407!!”
Reviews.Author: buffaloyann
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay in a superior double room. The website stated this type of room had a refrigerator, microwave, flat panel tv, ... and the photos on the website showed a nice size room. We checked in and we were given room 407. When we opened the door, we found nothing what was promised: no fridge, no microwave, no flatpanel TV, ... and you could hardly move in the room: the room was so small they had put the bed in the corner of the room (see pictures). More over, the room was located next to the elevator: you could hear the elevator go up and down all the time. Some pipings were located very close to the room so that made the room even noisier. In the morning we were woken up by the pigeons who lived just outside the roomwindow. The morning after our first night, we went down to complain. We had to sleep another day in that room; only the last two days we were given what we had paid for. That room (915) was very ok and just like what was showed on the website. So remember: avoid by any means room 407!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pilvinen
Reviews.Content: I can only say positive things about this hotel. We arrived rather early in the morning and not only we could check-in immediately, but we were also given a bigger room for the same price. The room was great with everything we needed (and probably more!) and the bathroom even had a bath tub, which is something I personally love. Not to mention that the hotel was very close to the subway, Starbucks and several other shops and restaurants that made our life a little easier when we didn't want to brave the cold weather at night. Last, but not least, the staff was always super nice with us and really helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for my parents”
Reviews.Author: BobbeD
Reviews.Content: I meant to review this hotel some months ago when my parents stayed there but have only just got around to it. I live in the city, and my parents came to visit for the week of my wedding. They are from a little village in England and this was their first visit to New York, and I was honestly a little terrified of how it would work out - I thought they'd find it noisy, hot, crowded etc. I think this hotel was probably the saving element of the visit - a peaceful, friendly haven at the end of each day made it easier for them to cope with the city. I upgraded them from two twins to a junior suite after seeing the size - while the two twins were a good size for NYC, the suite was not that much more and was a lot more spacious. The front desk staff were great, showing me several rooms to get a feel for the place and help me make my decision.
